What to add:

2. High-level code architecture and structure so that future instances can be productive more quickly. Focus on the "big picture" architecture that requires reading multiple files to understand.

Usage notes:
- If there's already a CLAUDE.md, suggest improvements to it.
- When you make the initial CLAUDE.md, do not repeat yourself and do not include obvious instructions like "Provide helpful error messages to users", "Write unit tests for all new utilities", "Never include sensitive information (API keys, tokens) in code or commits".
- Avoid listing every component or file structure that can be easily discovered.
- Don't include generic development practices.
- If there are Cursor rules (in .cursor/rules/ or .cursorrules) or Copilot rules (in .github/copilot-instructions.md), make sure to include the important parts.
- If there is a README.md, make sure to include the important parts.
- Do not make up information such as "Common Development Tasks", "Tips for Development", "Support and Documentation" unless this is expressly included in other files that you read.
- Be sure to prefix the file with the following text:

```
# CLAUDE.md

This file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with code in this repository.

üß∞ Tool Result: Toolu_01Knoirbkvhxhxisvqajznyu
2025-10-07 12:21:42 
     1‚Üí# Checkered Background Remover
     2‚Üí
     3‚ÜíA client-side React application that removes checkered patterns and solid backgrounds from images using OpenCV.js.
     4‚Üí
     5‚Üí## Features
     ...
 
     1‚Üí# Checkered Background Remover
     2‚Üí
     3‚ÜíA client-side React application that removes checkered patterns and solid backgrounds from images using OpenCV.js.
     4‚Üí
     5‚Üí## Features
     6‚Üí
     7‚Üí- üé® Remove checkered patterns (transparency indicators)
     8‚Üí- üñºÔ∏è Remove solid color backgrounds
     9‚Üí- üåì Remove shadows from backgrounds
    10‚Üí- üîí 100% client-side processing - your images never leave your browser
    11‚Üí- ‚ö° Fast processing with OpenCV.js
    12‚Üí- üì± Responsive design with TailwindCSS
    13‚Üí- üíæ Export as PNG with transparency
    14‚Üí
    15‚Üí## Live Demo
    16‚Üí
    17‚ÜíVisit: `https://jagadish-k.github.io/bg-remover/`
    18‚Üí
    19‚Üí## Local Development
    20‚Üí
    21‚Üí```bash
    22‚Üí# Install dependencies
    23‚Üínpm install
    24‚Üí
    25‚Üí# Start development server
    26‚Üínpm run dev
    27‚Üí
    28‚Üí# Build for production
    29‚Üínpm run build
    30‚Üí
    31‚Üí# Preview production build
    32‚Üínpm run preview
    33‚Üí```
    34‚Üí
    35‚Üí## How It Works
    36‚Üí
    37‚Üí1. Upload a PNG or JPG image
    38‚Üí2. Choose which processing options to apply:
    39‚Üí   - Remove checkered pattern
    40‚Üí   - Remove solid background
    41‚Üí   - Remove shadows
    42‚Üí3. Adjust the tolerance slider for fine-tuning
    43‚Üí4. Click "Process Image"
    44‚Üí5. Download the result as a transparent PNG
    45‚Üí
    46‚Üí## Tech Stack
    47‚Üí
    48‚Üí- React 19
    49‚Üí- TypeScript
    50‚Üí- Vite
    51‚Üí- TailwindCSS
    52‚Üí- OpenCV.js (via opencv-react-ts)
    53‚Üí- GitHub Actions for CI/CD
    54‚Üí
    55‚Üí## Privacy
    56‚Üí
    57‚ÜíAll image processing happens entirely in your browser using WebAssembly. No images are uploaded to any server.
    58‚Üí
    59‚Üí## License
    60‚Üí
    61‚ÜíMIT
    62‚Üí

<system-reminder>
Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it looks malicious. If it does, you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer high-level questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>

     1‚Üí# Checkered Background Remover
     2‚Üí
     3‚ÜíA client-side React application that removes checkered patterns and solid backgrounds from images using OpenCV.js.
     4‚Üí
     5‚Üí## Features
     ...
 
     1‚Üí# Checkered Background Remover
     2‚Üí
     3‚ÜíA client-side React application that removes checkered patterns and solid backgrounds from images using OpenCV.js.
     4‚Üí
     5‚Üí## Features
     6‚Üí
     7‚Üí- üé® Remove checkered patterns (transparency indicators)
     8‚Üí- üñºÔ∏è Remove solid color backgrounds
     9‚Üí- üåì Remove shadows from backgrounds
    10‚Üí- üîí 100% client-side processing - your images never leave your browser
    11‚Üí- ‚ö° Fast processing with OpenCV.js
    12‚Üí- üì± Responsive design with TailwindCSS
    13‚Üí- üíæ Export as PNG with transparency
    14‚Üí
    15‚Üí## Live Demo
    16‚Üí
    17‚ÜíVisit: `https://jagadish-k.github.io/bg-remover/`
    18‚Üí
    19‚Üí## Local Development
    20‚Üí
    21‚Üí```bash
    22‚Üí# Install dependencies
    23‚Üínpm install
    24‚Üí
    25‚Üí# Start development server
    26‚Üínpm run dev
    27‚Üí
    28‚Üí# Build for production
    29‚Üínpm run build
    30‚Üí
    31‚Üí# Preview production build
    32‚Üínpm run preview
    33‚Üí```
    34‚Üí
    35‚Üí## How It Works
    36‚Üí
    37‚Üí1. Upload a PNG or JPG image
    38‚Üí2. Choose which processing options to apply:
    39‚Üí   - Remove checkered pattern
    40‚Üí   - Remove solid background
    41‚Üí   - Remove shadows
    42‚Üí3. Adjust the tolerance slider for fine-tuning
    43‚Üí4. Click "Process Image"
    44‚Üí5. Download the result as a transparent PNG
    45‚Üí
    46‚Üí## Tech Stack
    47‚Üí
    48‚Üí- React 19
    49‚Üí- TypeScript
    50‚Üí- Vite
    51‚Üí- TailwindCSS
    52‚Üí- OpenCV.js (via opencv-react-ts)
    53‚Üí- GitHub Actions for CI/CD
    54‚Üí
    55‚Üí## Privacy
    56‚Üí
    57‚ÜíAll image processing happens entirely in your browser using WebAssembly. No images are uploaded to any server.
    58‚Üí
    59‚Üí## License
    60‚Üí
    61‚ÜíMIT
    62‚Üí

     1‚Üíimport { useState, useCallback } from 'react';
     2‚Üíimport { OpenCvProvider, useOpenCv } from 'opencv-react-ts';
     3‚Üíimport { ImageUploader } from './components/Im...
 
     1‚Üíimport { useState, useCallback } from 'react';
     2‚Üíimport { OpenCvProvider, useOpenCv } from 'opencv-react-ts';
     3‚Üíimport { ImageUploader } from './components/ImageUploader';
     4‚Üíimport { ProcessingControls } from './components/ProcessingControls';
     5‚Üíimport { processImage, type ProcessingOptions } from './utils/imageProcessor';
     6‚Üíimport { ResultModal } from './components/ResultModal';
     7‚Üí
     8‚Üífunction AppContent() {
     9‚Üí	const handleReset = useCallback(() => {
    10‚Üí		setOriginalImage(null);
    11‚Üí		setProcessedImage(null);
    12‚Üí		setFileName('');
    13‚Üí		setError(null);
    14‚Üí	}, []);
    15‚Üí	const { loaded, cv } = useOpenCv();
    16‚Üí	const [originalImage, setOriginalImage] = useState<HTMLImageElement | null>(null);
    17‚Üí	const [fileName, setFileName] = useState<string>('');
    18‚Üí	const [processedImage, setProcessedImage] = useState<string | null>(null);
    19‚Üí	const [processing, setProcessing] = useState(false);
    20‚Üí	const [error, setError] = useState<string | null>(null);
    21‚Üí	const [options, setOptions] = useState<ProcessingOptions>({
    22‚Üí		removeCheckered: true,
    23‚Üí		removeSolid: true,
    24‚Üí		removeShadow: false,
    25‚Üí		tolerance: 20,
    26‚Üí	});
    27‚Üí	const [modalOpen, setModalOpen] = useState(false);
    28‚Üí
    29‚Üí	const handleImageLoad = useCallback((image: HTMLImageElement, file: File) => {
    30‚Üí		setOriginalImage(image);
    31‚Üí		setFileName(file.name);
    32‚Üí		setProcessedImage(null);
    33‚Üí		setError(null);
    34‚Üí	}, []);
    35‚Üí
    36‚Üí	const handleProcess = useCallback(() => {
    37‚Üí		if (!originalImage || !loaded || !cv) return;
    38‚Üí
    39‚Üí		setProcessing(true);
    40‚Üí		setError(null);
    41‚Üí		setTimeout(() => {
    42‚Üí			try {
    43‚Üí				const result = processImage(cv, originalImage, options);
    44‚Üí				setProcessedImage(result);
    45‚Üí				setModalOpen(true);
    46‚Üí			} catch (err) {
    47‚Üí				console.error('Processing error:', err);
    48‚Üí				const details = err instanceof Error && err.message ? ` Details: ${err.message}` : '';
    49‚Üí				setError(`Error processing image. Please try a different image or adjust settings.${details}`);
    50‚Üí			} finally {
    51‚Üí				setProcessing(false);
    52‚Üí			}
    53‚Üí		}, 100);
    54‚Üí	}, [originalImage, options, loaded, cv]);
    55‚Üí
    56‚Üí	// For modal download (with optional crop)
    57‚Üí	const handleModalDownload = useCallback(
    58‚Üí		(croppedDataUrl?: string) => {
    59‚Üí			const url = croppedDataUrl || processedImage;
    60‚Üí			if (!url) return;
    61‚Üí			const link = document.createElement('a');
    62‚Üí			const newFileName = fileName.replace(/\.[^.]+$/, '-transparent.png');
    63‚Üí			link.href = url;
    64‚Üí			link.download = newFileName;
    65‚Üí			link.click();
    66‚Üí		},
    67‚Üí		[processedImage, fileName],
    68‚Üí	);
    69‚Üí
    70‚Üí	return (
    71‚Üí		<div className="min-h-screen w-full bg-gradient-to-br from-blue-50 to-indigo-100 grid grid-rows-[auto,1fr,auto]">
    72‚Üí			<header className="w-full py-10 px-4 text-center">
    73‚Üí				<h1 className="text-5xl font-extrabold text-blue-900 mb-4 tracking-tight drop-shadow-lg">Background Remover</h1>
    74‚Üí				<p className="text-lg text-gray-700 mb-2">
    75‚Üí					Remove checkered patterns and backgrounds from your images ‚Äî 100% client-side
    76‚Üí				</p>
    77‚Üí			</header>
    78‚Üí
    79‚Üí			<main className="w-full h-full grid place-items-center">
    80‚Üí				<div className="w-full max-w-6xl mx-auto px-4 grid grid-cols-1 md:grid-cols-2 gap-12 items-start">
    81‚Üí					{/* Left: Image preview/upload */}
    82‚Üí					<section className="flex flex-col items-center justify-center w-full">
    83‚Üí						{!loaded && (
    84‚Üí							<div className="text-center py-12">
    85‚Üí								<div className="inline-block animate-spin rounded-full h-12 w-12 border-b-2 border-blue-600 mb-4"></div>
    86‚Üí								<p className="text-gray-600">Loading OpenCV...</p>
    87‚Üí								<p className="text-sm text-gray-500 mt-2">This may take a moment on first load</p>
    88‚Üí							</div>
    89‚Üí						)}
    90‚Üí						{error && (
    91‚Üí							<div
    92‚Üí								role="alert"
    93‚Üí								className="bg-red-50 border border-red-300 text-red-800 px-4 py-3 rounded-lg mb-6 w-full max-w-lg shadow-sm">
    94‚Üí								<p className="font-semibold flex items-center gap-2">
    95‚Üí									<span className="inline-block h-2.5 w-2.5 rounded-full bg-red-500"></span>
    96‚Üí									Processing failed
    97‚Üí								</p>
    98‚Üí								<p className="text-sm mt-1">{error}</p>
    99‚Üí							</div>
   100‚Üí						)}
   101‚Üí						{!originalImage ? (
   102‚Üí							<div className="w-full max-w-lg">
   103‚Üí								<h2 className="text-3xl font-bold mb-8 text-blue-700 text-center">Upload Image</h2>
   104‚Üí								<ImageUploader onImageLoad={handleImageLoad} />
   105‚Üí							</div>
   106‚Üí						) : (
   107‚Üí							<div className="w-full max-w-lg flex flex-col items-center gap-4">
   108‚Üí								<div
   109‚Üí									className="relative w-full bg-gray-50 rounded-xl border flex items-center justify-center"
   110‚Üí									style={{ minHeight: '320px' }}>
   111‚Üí									<img
   112‚Üí										src={originalImage.src}
   113‚Üí										alt="Original"
   114‚Üí										className="max-h-96 object-contain rounded-xl w-full"
   115‚Üí									/>
   116‚Üí								</div>
   117‚Üí								<p className="text-sm text-gray-600 truncate text-center">{fileName}</p>
   118‚Üí								<button
   119‚Üí									onClick={handleReset}
   120‚Üí									className="text-xs text-gray-500 hover:text-blue-700 bg-gray-100 hover:bg-gray-200 px-3 py-1 rounded transition-colors">
   121‚Üí									Clear
   122‚Üí								</button>
   123‚Üí								{processing && (
   124‚Üí									<div className="text-center py-6">
   125‚Üí										<div className="inline-block animate-spin rounded-full h-8 w-8 border-b-2 border-blue-600 mb-2"></div>
   126‚Üí										<p className="text-gray-600">Processing image...</p>
   127‚Üí									</div>
   128‚Üí								)}
   129‚Üí							</div>
   130‚Üí						)}
   131‚Üí					</section>
   132‚Üí					{/* Right: Controls/tips (only after image is selected) */}
   133‚Üí					{originalImage && (
   134‚Üí						<aside className="flex flex-col items-center justify-start w-full md:col-start-2">
   135‚Üí							<div className="w-full max-w-md">
   136‚Üí								<ProcessingControls
   137‚Üí									options={options}
   138‚Üí									onOptionsChange={setOptions}
   139‚Üí									onProcess={handleProcess}
   140‚Üí									disabled={processing}
   141‚Üí								/>
   142‚Üí							</div>
   143‚Üí							<div className="bg-blue-50 border border-blue-200 rounded-xl p-4 w-full max-w-md mt-8">
   144‚Üí								<h4 className="font-semibold text-blue-900 mb-2 text-sm">Tips:</h4>
   145‚Üí								<ul className="text-xs text-blue-800 space-y-1">
   146‚Üí									<li>‚Ä¢ Works best with standard gray checkered patterns</li>
   147‚Üí									<li>‚Ä¢ Adjust tolerance if background isn't fully removed</li>
   148‚Üí									<li>‚Ä¢ Shadow removal works best on light backgrounds</li>
   149‚Üí									<li>‚Ä¢ All processing happens in your browser ‚Äî no uploads!</li>
   150‚Üí								</ul>
   151‚Üí							</div>
   152‚Üí						</aside>
   153‚Üí					)}
   154‚Üí				</div>
   155‚Üí			</main>
   156‚Üí
   157‚Üí			<ResultModal
   158‚Üí				imageSrc={processedImage || ''}
   159‚Üí				open={modalOpen && !!processedImage}
   160‚Üí				onClose={() => setModalOpen(false)}
   161‚Üí				onDownload={handleModalDownload}
   162‚Üí			/>
   163‚Üí
   164‚Üí			<footer className="w-full text-center py-8 text-sm text-gray-600 border-t border-gray-200 bg-white/80">
   165‚Üí				<p>Built with React, TypeScript, and OpenCV.js ‚Ä¢ All processing is done locally in your browser</p>
   166‚Üí			</footer>
   167‚Üí		</div>
   168‚Üí	);
   169‚Üí}
   170‚Üí
   171‚Üífunction App() {
   172‚Üí	return (
   173‚Üí		<OpenCvProvider>
   174‚Üí			<AppContent />
   175‚Üí		</OpenCvProvider>
   176‚Üí	);
   177‚Üí}
   178‚Üí
   179‚Üíexport default App;
   180‚Üí

     5‚Üí

     7‚Üí  <StrictMode>

   105‚Üí							</div>

   127‚Üí									</div>

   136‚Üí								<ProcessingControls
   137‚Üí									options={options}
   138‚Üí									onOptionsChange={setOptions}
   139‚Üí									onProcess={handleProcess}
   140‚Üí									disabled={processing}
   141‚Üí								/>
   142‚Üí							</div>
   143‚Üí							<div className="bg-blue-50 border border-blue-200 rounded-xl p-4 w-full max-w-md mt-8">

   145‚Üí								<ul className="text-xs text-blue-800 space-y-1">
   146‚Üí									<li>‚Ä¢ Works best with standard gray checkered patterns</li>
   147‚Üí									<li>‚Ä¢ Adjust tolerance if background isn't fully removed</li>
   148‚Üí									<li>‚Ä¢ Shadow removal works best on light backgrounds</li>
   149‚Üí									<li>‚Ä¢ All processing happens in your browser ‚Äî no uploads!</li>
   150‚Üí								</ul>
   151‚Üí							</div>
   152‚Üí						</aside>
   153‚Üí					)}
   154‚Üí				</div>
   155‚Üí			</main>
   156‚Üí
   157‚Üí			<ResultModal
   158‚Üí				imageSrc={processedImage || ''}
   159‚Üí				open={modalOpen && !!processedImage}
   160‚Üí				onClose={() => setModalOpen(false)}
   161‚Üí				onDownload={handleModalDownload}
   162‚Üí			/>
   163‚Üí
   164‚Üí			<footer className="w-full text-center py-8 text-sm text-gray-600 border-t border-gray-200 bg-white/80">
   165‚Üí				<p>Built with React, TypeScript, and OpenCV.js ‚Ä¢ All processing is done locally in your browser</p>
   166‚Üí			</footer>
   167‚Üí		</div>
   168‚Üí	);
   169‚Üí}
   170‚Üí
   171‚Üífunction App() {
   172‚Üí	return (
   173‚Üí		<OpenCvProvider>
   174‚Üí			<AppContent />
   175‚Üí		</OpenCvProvider>
   176‚Üí	);
   177‚Üí}
   178‚Üí
   179‚Üíexport default App;

2025-10-07 12:21:48 
     1‚Üíimport { StrictMode } from 'react'
     2‚Üíimport { createRoot } from 'react-dom/client'
     3‚Üíimport './index.css'
     4‚Üíimport App from './App.tsx'
  ...
 
     1‚Üíimport { StrictMode } from 'react'

     4‚Üíimport App from './App.tsx'
     5‚Üí
     6‚ÜícreateRoot(document.getElementById('root')!).render(
     7‚Üí  <StrictMode>
     8‚Üí    <App />
     9‚Üí  </StrictMode>,
    10‚Üí)
    11‚Üí

üß∞ Tool Result: Toolu_01Phjb2Hu66Ndu2Zajrj4Nb8
2025-10-07 12:21:53 
     1‚Üíexport interface ProcessingOptions {
     2‚Üí	removeCheckered: boolean;
     3‚Üí	removeSolid: boolean;
     4‚Üí	removeShadow: boolean;
     5‚Üí	tolerance: number;
     6‚Üí}
     7‚Üí
     8‚Üíexport con...
 
     1‚Üíexport interface ProcessingOptions {
     2‚Üí	removeCheckered: boolean;
     3‚Üí	removeSolid: boolean;
     4‚Üí	removeShadow: boolean;
     5‚Üí	tolerance: number;
     6‚Üí}
     7‚Üí
     8‚Üíexport const processImage = (cv: any, imageElement: HTMLImageElement, options: ProcessingOptions): string => {
     9‚Üí	if (!cv) {
    10‚Üí		throw new Error('OpenCV is not loaded yet. Please wait a moment and try again.');
    11‚Üí	}
    12‚Üí	// Read image
    13‚Üí	const src = cv.imread(imageElement);
    14‚Üí	const dst = new cv.Mat();
    15‚Üí
    16‚Üí	try {
    17‚Üí		// Convert to RGBA if not already
    18‚Üí		if (src.channels() === 3) {
    19‚Üí			cv.cvtColor(src, src, cv.COLOR_RGB2RGBA);
    20‚Üí		}
    21‚Üí
    22‚Üí		// Create alpha channel
    23‚Üí		const alpha = new cv.Mat(src.rows, src.cols, cv.CV_8UC1, new cv.Scalar(255));
    24‚Üí
    25‚Üí		// Detect and remove checkered pattern
    26‚Üí		if (options.removeCheckered) {
    27‚Üí			removeCheckeredPattern(cv, src, alpha, options.tolerance);
    28‚Üí		}
    29‚Üí
    30‚Üí		// Remove solid background (detect dominant color at edges)
    31‚Üí		if (options.removeSolid) {
    32‚Üí			removeSolidBackground(cv, src, alpha, options.tolerance);
    33‚Üí		}
    34‚Üí
    35‚Üí		// Remove shadows (detect darker regions)
    36‚Üí		if (options.removeShadow) {
    37‚Üí			removeShadows(cv, src, alpha, options.tolerance);
    38‚Üí		}
    39‚Üí
    40‚Üí		// Apply alpha channel
    41‚Üí		const channels = new cv.MatVector();
    42‚Üí		cv.split(src, channels);
    43‚Üí		channels.set(3, alpha);
    44‚Üí		cv.merge(channels, dst);
    45‚Üí
    46‚Üí		// Create canvas and export at native resolution
    47‚Üí		const canvas = document.createElement('canvas');
    48‚Üí		canvas.width = imageElement.naturalWidth || src.cols;
    49‚Üí		canvas.height = imageElement.naturalHeight || src.rows;
    50‚Üí		cv.imshow(canvas, dst);
    51‚Üí		const dataUrl = canvas.toDataURL('image/png');
    52‚Üí
    53‚Üí		// Cleanup
    54‚Üí		channels.delete();
    55‚Üí		alpha.delete();
    56‚Üí
    57‚Üí		return dataUrl;
    58‚Üí	} finally {
    59‚Üí		src.delete();
    60‚Üí		dst.delete();
    61‚Üí	}
    62‚Üí};
    63‚Üí
    64‚Üífunction removeCheckeredPattern(_cv: any, src: any, alpha: any, tolerance: number): void {
    65‚Üí	// Sample corner pixels to detect checkered pattern colors
    66‚Üí	const colors = sampleCheckerColors(src);
    67‚Üí
    68‚Üí	// Remove pixels matching checker pattern
    69‚Üí	for (let y = 0; y < src.rows; y++) {
    70‚Üí		for (let x = 0; x < src.cols; x++) {
    71‚Üí			const pixel = src.ucharPtr(y, x);
    72‚Üí			const r = pixel[0];
    73‚Üí			const g = pixel[1];
    74‚Üí			const b = pixel[2];
    75‚Üí
    76‚Üí			// Check if pixel matches any checker color
    77‚Üí			for (const color of colors) {
    78‚Üí				const diff = Math.abs(r - color.r) + Math.abs(g - color.g) + Math.abs(b - color.b);
    79‚Üí				if (diff < tolerance * 3) {
    80‚Üí					alpha.ucharPtr(y, x)[0] = 0;
    81‚Üí					break;
    82‚Üí				}
    83‚Üí			}
    84‚Üí		}
    85‚Üí	}
    86‚Üí}
    87‚Üí
    88‚Üífunction sampleCheckerColors(src: any): Array<{ r: number; g: number; b: number }> {
    89‚Üí	// Sample pixels from corners and edges to detect pattern
    90‚Üí	const samples: Array<{ r: number; g: number; b: number }> = [];
    91‚Üí	// Note: sample from fixed points; dynamic sample size not used currently
    92‚Üí
    93‚Üí	const samplePoints = [
    94‚Üí		[0, 0],
    95‚Üí		[10, 10],
    96‚Üí		[20, 20],
    97‚Üí		[src.cols - 1, 0],
    98‚Üí		[src.cols - 11, 10],
    99‚Üí		[0, src.rows - 1],
   100‚Üí		[10, src.rows - 11],
   101‚Üí	];
   102‚Üí
   103‚Üí	for (const [x, y] of samplePoints) {
   104‚Üí		if (x >= 0 && x < src.cols && y >= 0 && y < src.rows) {
   105‚Üí			const pixel = src.ucharPtr(y, x);
   106‚Üí			samples.push({ r: pixel[0], g: pixel[1], b: pixel[2] });
   107‚Üí		}
   108‚Üí	}
   109‚Üí
   110‚Üí	// Cluster similar colors
   111‚Üí	const clustered = clusterColors(samples, 15);
   112‚Üí	return clustered;
   113‚Üí}
   114‚Üí
   115‚Üífunction clusterColors(
   116‚Üí	colors: Array<{ r: number; g: number; b: number }>,
   117‚Üí	threshold: number,
   118‚Üí): Array<{ r: number; g: number; b: number }> {
   119‚Üí	if (colors.length === 0) return [];
   120‚Üí
   121‚Üí	const clusters: Array<{ r: number; g: number; b: number }> = [colors[0]];
   122‚Üí
   123‚Üí	for (const color of colors) {
   124‚Üí		let foundCluster = false;
   125‚Üí		for (const cluster of clusters) {
   126‚Üí			const diff = Math.abs(color.r - cluster.r) + Math.abs(color.g - cluster.g) + Math.abs(color.b - cluster.b);
   127‚Üí			if (diff < threshold) {
   128‚Üí				foundCluster = true;
   129‚Üí				break;
   130‚Üí			}
   131‚Üí		}
   132‚Üí		if (!foundCluster) {
   133‚Üí			clusters.push(color);
   134‚Üí		}
   135‚Üí	}
   136‚Üí
   137‚Üí	return clusters;
   138‚Üí}
   139‚Üí
   140‚Üífunction removeSolidBackground(cv: any, src: any, alpha: any, tolerance: number): void {
   141‚Üí	// Sample edge pixels to detect background color
   142‚Üí	const bgColor = detectBackgroundColor(src);
   143‚Üí
   144‚Üí	// Use flood fill from corners - mask must be (rows+2, cols+2) CV_8UC1
   145‚Üí	const mask = new cv.Mat(src.rows + 2, src.cols + 2, cv.CV_8UC1, new cv.Scalar(0));
   146‚Üí	const fillColor = new cv.Scalar(255, 255, 255, 255);
   147‚Üí	const seedPoint = new cv.Point(0, 0);
   148‚Üí
   149‚Üí	// Create mask for flood fill (use loDiff/hiDiff and fixed connectivity)
   150‚Üí	try {
   151‚Üí		cv.floodFill(
   152‚Üí			src,
   153‚Üí			mask,
   154‚Üí			seedPoint,
   155‚Üí			fillColor,
   156‚Üí			new cv.Rect(),
   157‚Üí			new cv.Scalar(tolerance, tolerance, tolerance, 0),
   158‚Üí			new cv.Scalar(tolerance, tolerance, tolerance, 0),
   159‚Üí			4 /* 4-connectivity */,
   160‚Üí		);
   161‚Üí	} catch (e) {
   162‚Üí		// If floodFill fails (e.g., due to format), continue with color-diff approach only
   163‚Üí		console.warn('floodFill failed, continuing with color-diff removal', e);
   164‚Üí	}
   165‚Üí
   166‚Üí	// Remove pixels matching background color
   167‚Üí	for (let y = 0; y < src.rows; y++) {
   168‚Üí		for (let x = 0; x < src.cols; x++) {
   169‚Üí			const pixel = src.ucharPtr(y, x);
   170‚Üí			const r = pixel[0];
   171‚Üí			const g = pixel[1];
   172‚Üí			const b = pixel[2];
   173‚Üí
   174‚Üí			const diff = Math.abs(r - bgColor.r) + Math.abs(g - bgColor.g) + Math.abs(b - bgColor.b);
   175‚Üí			if (diff < tolerance * 3) {
   176‚Üí				alpha.ucharPtr(y, x)[0] = 0;
   177‚Üí			}
   178‚Üí		}
   179‚Üí	}
   180‚Üí
   181‚Üí	mask.delete();
   182‚Üí}
   183‚Üí
   184‚Üífunction detectBackgroundColor(src: any): { r: number; g: number; b: number } {
   185‚Üí	// Sample all four edges to find most common color
   186‚Üí	const edgeSamples: number[][] = [];
   187‚Üí
   188‚Üí	const sampleStep = 5;
   189‚Üí
   190‚Üí	// Top edge
   191‚Üí	for (let x = 0; x < src.cols; x += sampleStep) {
   192‚Üí		const pixel = src.ucharPtr(0, x);
   193‚Üí		edgeSamples.push([pixel[0], pixel[1], pixel[2]]);
   194‚Üí	}
   195‚Üí
   196‚Üí	// Bottom edge
   197‚Üí	for (let x = 0; x < src.cols; x += sampleStep) {
   198‚Üí		const pixel = src.ucharPtr(src.rows - 1, x);
   199‚Üí		edgeSamples.push([pixel[0], pixel[1], pixel[2]]);
   200‚Üí	}
   201‚Üí
   202‚Üí	// Left edge
   203‚Üí	for (let y = 0; y < src.rows; y += sampleStep) {
   204‚Üí		const pixel = src.ucharPtr(y, 0);
   205‚Üí		edgeSamples.push([pixel[0], pixel[1], pixel[2]]);
   206‚Üí	}
   207‚Üí
   208‚Üí	// Right edge
   209‚Üí	for (let y = 0; y < src.rows; y += sampleStep) {
   210‚Üí		const pixel = src.ucharPtr(y, src.cols - 1);
   211‚Üí		edgeSamples.push([pixel[0], pixel[1], pixel[2]]);
   212‚Üí	}
   213‚Üí
   214‚Üí	// Calculate average
   215‚Üí	const avg = edgeSamples.reduce(
   216‚Üí		(acc, color) => ({
   217‚Üí			r: acc.r + color[0],
   218‚Üí			g: acc.g + color[1],
   219‚Üí			b: acc.b + color[2],
   220‚Üí		}),
   221‚Üí		{ r: 0, g: 0, b: 0 },
   222‚Üí	);
   223‚Üí
   224‚Üí	const count = edgeSamples.length;
   225‚Üí	return {
   226‚Üí		r: Math.round(avg.r / count),
   227‚Üí		g: Math.round(avg.g / count),
   228‚Üí		b: Math.round(avg.b / count),
   229‚Üí	};
   230‚Üí}
   231‚Üí
   232‚Üífunction removeShadows(cv: any, src: any, alpha: any, tolerance: number): void {
   233‚Üí	// Convert to HSV to better detect shadows
   234‚Üí	const hsv = new cv.Mat();
   235‚Üí	cv.cvtColor(src, hsv, cv.COLOR_RGBA2RGB);
   236‚Üí	cv.cvtColor(hsv, hsv, cv.COLOR_RGB2HSV);
   237‚Üí
   238‚Üí	// Split channels
   239‚Üí	const channels = new cv.MatVector();
   240‚Üí	cv.split(hsv, channels);
   241‚Üí
   242‚Üí	// Value channel (brightness)
   243‚Üí	const vChannel = channels.get(2);
   244‚Üí
   245‚Üí	// Threshold to find dark regions (shadows)
   246‚Üí	const shadowMask = new cv.Mat();
   247‚Üí	cv.threshold(vChannel, shadowMask, tolerance * 2.5, 255, cv.THRESH_BINARY_INV);
   248‚Üí
   249‚Üí	// Apply morphological operations to clean up
   250‚Üí	const kernel = cv.getStructuringElement(cv.MORPH_ELLIPSE, new cv.Size(5, 5));
   251‚Üí	cv.morphologyEx(shadowMask, shadowMask, cv.MORPH_OPEN, kernel);
   252‚Üí	cv.morphologyEx(shadowMask, shadowMask, cv.MORPH_CLOSE, kernel);
   253‚Üí
   254‚Üí	// Blur to soften edges
   255‚Üí	cv.GaussianBlur(shadowMask, shadowMask, new cv.Size(5, 5), 0);
   256‚Üí
   257‚Üí	// Apply to alpha with feathering
   258‚Üí	for (let y = 0; y < src.rows; y++) {
   259‚Üí		for (let x = 0; x < src.cols; x++) {
   260‚Üí			const shadowValue = shadowMask.ucharPtr(y, x)[0];
   261‚Üí			if (shadowValue > 128) {
   262‚Üí				const currentAlpha = alpha.ucharPtr(y, x)[0];
   263‚Üí				// Gradually reduce alpha based on shadow intensity
   264‚Üí				const newAlpha = Math.floor(currentAlpha * (1 - shadowValue / 255));
   265‚Üí				alpha.ucharPtr(y, x)[0] = newAlpha;
   266‚Üí			}
   267‚Üí		}
   268‚Üí	}
   269‚Üí
   270‚Üí	hsv.delete();
   271‚Üí	channels.delete();
   272‚Üí	vChannel.delete();
   273‚Üí	shadowMask.delete();
   274‚Üí	kernel.delete();
   275‚Üí}
   276‚Üí

</system-reminder>

    10‚Üí  contents: read
    11‚Üí  ...
 
     1‚Üíname: Deploy to GitHub Pages
     2‚Üí
     3‚Üíon:
     4‚Üí  push:
     5‚Üí    branches:
     6‚Üí      - main
     7‚Üí  workflow_dispatch:
     8‚Üí
     9‚Üípermissions:
    10‚Üí  contents: read
    11‚Üí  pages: write
    12‚Üí  id-token: write
    13‚Üí
    14‚Üíconcurrency:
    15‚Üí  group: "pages"
    16‚Üí  cancel-in-progress: false
    17‚Üí
    18‚Üíjobs:
    19‚Üí  build:
    20‚Üí    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    21‚Üí    steps:
    22‚Üí      - name: Checkout
    23‚Üí        uses: actions/checkout@v4
    24‚Üí
    25‚Üí      - name: Setup Node
    26‚Üí        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
    27‚Üí        with:
    28‚Üí          node-version: "20"
    29‚Üí          cache: "npm"
    30‚Üí
    31‚Üí      - name: Install dependencies
    32‚Üí        run: npm ci
    33‚Üí
    34‚Üí      - name: Build
    35‚Üí        run: npm run build
    36‚Üí
    37‚Üí      - name: Upload artifact
    38‚Üí        uses: actions/upload-pages-artifact@v3
    39‚Üí        with:
    40‚Üí          path: ./dist
    41‚Üí
    42‚Üí  deploy:
    43‚Üí    environment:
    44‚Üí      name: github-pages
    45‚Üí      url: ${{ steps.deployment.outputs.page_url }}
    46‚Üí    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    47‚Üí    needs: build
    48‚Üí    steps:
    49‚Üí      - name: Deploy to GitHub Pages
    50‚Üí        id: deployment
    51‚Üí        uses: actions/deploy-pages@v4
    52‚Üí

üß∞ Tool Result: Toolu_011Fmoyzmop5Xf2Notut7Uqt
2025-10-07 12:21:53 
     1‚Üíimport React from 'react';
     2‚Üíimport type { ProcessingOptions } from '../utils/imageProcessor';
     3‚Üí
     4‚Üíinterface ProcessingControlsProps {
     5‚Üí	options: Proce...
 
     1‚Üíimport React from 'react';
     2‚Üíimport type { ProcessingOptions } from '../utils/imageProcessor';
     3‚Üí
     4‚Üíinterface ProcessingControlsProps {
     5‚Üí	options: ProcessingOptions;
     6‚Üí	onOptionsChange: (options: ProcessingOptions) => void;
     7‚Üí	onProcess: () => void;
     8‚Üí	disabled: boolean;
     9‚Üí}
    10‚Üí
    11‚Üíexport const ProcessingControls: React.FC<ProcessingControlsProps> = ({
    12‚Üí	options,
    13‚Üí	onOptionsChange,
    14‚Üí	onProcess,
    15‚Üí	disabled,
    16‚Üí}) => {
    17‚Üí	return (
    18‚Üí		<div className="bg-white rounded-lg shadow-lg p-6">
    19‚Üí			<h3 className="font-semibold text-lg mb-4">Processing Options</h3>
    20‚Üí
    21‚Üí			<div className="space-y-4">
    22‚Üí				<div className="space-y-3">
    23‚Üí					<label className="flex items-center space-x-3 cursor-pointer group">
    24‚Üí						<input
    25‚Üí							type="checkbox"
    26‚Üí							checked={options.removeCheckered}
    27‚Üí							onChange={(e) => onOptionsChange({ ...options, removeCheckered: e.target.checked })}
    28‚Üí							className="w-4 h-4 text-blue-600 rounded focus:ring-2 focus:ring-blue-500"
    29‚Üí						/>
    30‚Üí						<span className="text-sm group-hover:text-blue-600 transition-colors">Remove checkered pattern</span>
    31‚Üí					</label>
    32‚Üí
    33‚Üí					<label className="flex items-center space-x-3 cursor-pointer group">
    34‚Üí						<input
    35‚Üí							type="checkbox"
    36‚Üí							checked={options.removeSolid}
    37‚Üí							onChange={(e) => onOptionsChange({ ...options, removeSolid: e.target.checked })}
    38‚Üí							className="w-4 h-4 text-blue-600 rounded focus:ring-2 focus:ring-blue-500"
    39‚Üí						/>
    40‚Üí						<span className="text-sm group-hover:text-blue-600 transition-colors">Remove solid background</span>
    41‚Üí					</label>
    42‚Üí
    43‚Üí					<label className="flex items-center space-x-3 cursor-pointer group">
    44‚Üí						<input
    45‚Üí							type="checkbox"
    46‚Üí							checked={options.removeShadow}
    47‚Üí							onChange={(e) => onOptionsChange({ ...options, removeShadow: e.target.checked })}
    48‚Üí							className="w-4 h-4 text-blue-600 rounded focus:ring-2 focus:ring-blue-500"
    49‚Üí						/>
    50‚Üí						<span className="text-sm group-hover:text-blue-600 transition-colors">Remove shadows</span>
    51‚Üí					</label>
    52‚Üí				</div>
    53‚Üí
    54‚Üí				<div className="pt-2 border-t border-gray-100">
    55‚Üí					<label className="block text-sm font-medium text-gray-700 mb-3">
    56‚Üí						Tolerance: <span className="text-blue-600 font-semibold">{options.tolerance}</span>
    57‚Üí					</label>
    58‚Üí					<input
    59‚Üí						type="range"
    60‚Üí						min="5"
    61‚Üí						max="50"
    62‚Üí						value={options.tolerance}
    63‚Üí						onChange={(e) => onOptionsChange({ ...options, tolerance: parseInt(e.target.value) })}
    64‚Üí						className="w-full h-2 bg-gray-200 rounded-lg appearance-none cursor-pointer accent-blue-600"
    65‚Üí					/>
    66‚Üí					<div className="flex justify-between text-xs text-gray-500 mt-1">
    67‚Üí						<span>Strict</span>
    68‚Üí						<span>Lenient</span>
    69‚Üí					</div>
    70‚Üí					<p className="text-xs text-gray-500 mt-2">Higher tolerance removes more similar colors</p>
    71‚Üí				</div>
    72‚Üí
    73‚Üí				<button
    74‚Üí					onClick={onProcess}
    75‚Üí					disabled={disabled}
    76‚Üí					aria-busy={disabled}
    77‚Üí					className="w-full flex items-center justify-center gap-2 bg-blue-600 text-white py-3 px-4 rounded-lg hover:bg-blue-700 disabled:bg-gray-400 disabled:cursor-not-allowed transition-colors font-medium shadow-sm text-sm">
    78‚Üí					{disabled && <span className="inline-block animate-spin rounded-full h-4 w-4 border-b-2 border-white"></span>}
    79‚Üí					<span>{disabled ? 'Processing‚Ä¶' : 'Process Image'}</span>
    80‚Üí				</button>
    81‚Üí			</div>
    82‚Üí		</div>
    83‚Üí	);
    84‚Üí};
    85‚Üí

</system-reminder>

2025-10-07 12:21:53 
     1‚Üíimport React, { useCallback } from 'react';
     2‚Üí
     3‚Üíinterface ImageUploaderProps {
     4‚Üí	onImageLoad: (image: HTMLImageElement, file: File) => void;
     5‚Üí}
     6‚Üí
     ...
 
     1‚Üíimport React, { useCallback } from 'react';
     2‚Üí
     3‚Üíinterface ImageUploaderProps {
     4‚Üí	onImageLoad: (image: HTMLImageElement, file: File) => void;
     5‚Üí}
     6‚Üí
     7‚Üíexport const ImageUploader: React.FC<ImageUploaderProps> = ({ onImageLoad }) => {
     8‚Üí	const handleFileChange = useCallback(
     9‚Üí		(event: React.ChangeEvent<HTMLInputElement>) => {
    10‚Üí			const file = event.target.files?.[0];
    11‚Üí			if (!file) return;
    12‚Üí
    13‚Üí			const reader = new FileReader();
    14‚Üí			reader.onload = (e) => {
    15‚Üí				const img = new Image();
    16‚Üí				img.onload = () => onImageLoad(img, file);
    17‚Üí				img.src = e.target?.result as string;
    18‚Üí			};
    19‚Üí			reader.readAsDataURL(file);
    20‚Üí		},
    21‚Üí		[onImageLoad],
    22‚Üí	);
    23‚Üí
    24‚Üí	const handleDrop = useCallback(
    25‚Üí		(event: React.DragEvent) => {
    26‚Üí			event.preventDefault();
    27‚Üí			const file = event.dataTransfer.files[0];
    28‚Üí			if (file && (file.type === 'image/png' || file.type === 'image/jpeg')) {
    29‚Üí				const reader = new FileReader();
    30‚Üí				reader.onload = (e) => {
    31‚Üí					const img = new Image();
    32‚Üí					img.onload = () => onImageLoad(img, file);
    33‚Üí					img.src = e.target?.result as string;
    34‚Üí				};
    35‚Üí				reader.readAsDataURL(file);
    36‚Üí			}
    37‚Üí		},
    38‚Üí		[onImageLoad],
    39‚Üí	);
    40‚Üí
    41‚Üí	const handleDragOver = (event: React.DragEvent) => {
    42‚Üí		event.preventDefault();
    43‚Üí	};
    44‚Üí
    45‚Üí	return (
    46‚Üí		<div
    47‚Üí			onDrop={handleDrop}
    48‚Üí			onDragOver={handleDragOver}
    49‚Üí			className="border-2 border-dashed border-gray-300 rounded-lg p-8 md:p-10 text-center hover:border-blue-500 hover:bg-blue-50 transition-all duration-200 cursor-pointer group">
    50‚Üí			<input
    51‚Üí				type="file"
    52‚Üí				accept="image/png,image/jpeg"
    53‚Üí				onChange={handleFileChange}
    54‚Üí				className="hidden"
    55‚Üí				id="file-upload"
    56‚Üí			/>
    57‚Üí			<label
    58‚Üí				htmlFor="file-upload"
    59‚Üí				className="cursor-pointer block">
    60‚Üí				<div className="space-y-3">
    61‚Üí					<svg
    62‚Üí						className="mx-auto h-12 w-12 md:h-14 md:w-14 text-gray-400 group-hover:text-blue-500 transition-colors"
    63‚Üí						stroke="currentColor"
    64‚Üí						fill="none"
    65‚Üí						viewBox="0 0 48 48">
    66‚Üí						<path
    67‚Üí							d="M28 8H12a4 4 0 00-4 4v20m32-12v8m0 0v8a4 4 0 01-4 4H12a4 4 0 01-4-4v-4m32-4l-3.172-3.172a4 4 0 00-5.656 0L28 28M8 32l9.172-9.172a4 4 0 015.656 0L28 28m0 0l4 4m4-24h8m-4-4v8m-12 4h.02"
    68‚Üí							strokeWidth={2}
    69‚Üí							strokeLinecap="round"
    70‚Üí							strokeLinejoin="round"
    71‚Üí						/>
    72‚Üí					</svg>
    73‚Üí					<div className="space-y-1">
    74‚Üí						<div className="text-gray-600">
    75‚Üí							<span className="font-semibold text-blue-600 group-hover:text-blue-700 transition-colors">
    76‚Üí								Click to upload
    77‚Üí							</span>{' '}
    78‚Üí							or drag and drop
    79‚Üí						</div>
    80‚Üí						<p className="text-xs md:text-sm text-gray-500">PNG or JPG files (max 10MB)</p>
    81‚Üí					</div>
    82‚Üí				</div>
    83‚Üí			</label>
    84‚Üí		</div>
    85‚Üí	);
    86‚Üí};
    87‚Üí

üß∞ Tool Result: Toolu_01Phjb2Hu66Ndu2Zajrj4Nb8
2025-10-07 12:21:53 
     1‚Üíexport interface ProcessingOptions {
     2‚Üí	removeCheckered: boolean;
     3‚Üí	removeSolid: boolean;
     4‚Üí	removeShadow: boolean;
     5‚Üí	tolerance: number;
     6‚Üí}
     7‚Üí
     8‚Üíexport con...
 
     1‚Üíexport interface ProcessingOptions {
     2‚Üí	removeCheckered: boolean;
     3‚Üí	removeSolid: boolean;
     4‚Üí	removeShadow: boolean;
     5‚Üí	tolerance: number;
     6‚Üí}
     7‚Üí
     8‚Üíexport const processImage = (cv: any, imageElement: HTMLImageElement, options: ProcessingOptions): string => {
     9‚Üí	if (!cv) {
    10‚Üí		throw new Error('OpenCV is not loaded yet. Please wait a moment and try again.');
    11‚Üí	}
    12‚Üí	// Read image
    13‚Üí	const src = cv.imread(imageElement);
    14‚Üí	const dst = new cv.Mat();
    15‚Üí
    16‚Üí	try {
    17‚Üí		// Convert to RGBA if not already
    18‚Üí		if (src.channels() === 3) {
    19‚Üí			cv.cvtColor(src, src, cv.COLOR_RGB2RGBA);
    20‚Üí		}
    21‚Üí
    22‚Üí		// Create alpha channel
    23‚Üí		const alpha = new cv.Mat(src.rows, src.cols, cv.CV_8UC1, new cv.Scalar(255));
    24‚Üí
    25‚Üí		// Detect and remove checkered pattern
    26‚Üí		if (options.removeCheckered) {
    27‚Üí			removeCheckeredPattern(cv, src, alpha, options.tolerance);
    28‚Üí		}
    29‚Üí
    30‚Üí		// Remove solid background (detect dominant color at edges)
    31‚Üí		if (options.removeSolid) {
    32‚Üí			removeSolidBackground(cv, src, alpha, options.tolerance);
    33‚Üí		}
    34‚Üí
    35‚Üí		// Remove shadows (detect darker regions)
    36‚Üí		if (options.removeShadow) {
    37‚Üí			removeShadows(cv, src, alpha, options.tolerance);
    38‚Üí		}
    39‚Üí
    40‚Üí		// Apply alpha channel
    41‚Üí		const channels = new cv.MatVector();
    42‚Üí		cv.split(src, channels);
    43‚Üí		channels.set(3, alpha);
    44‚Üí		cv.merge(channels, dst);
    45‚Üí
    46‚Üí		// Create canvas and export at native resolution
    47‚Üí		const canvas = document.createElement('canvas');
    48‚Üí		canvas.width = imageElement.naturalWidth || src.cols;
    49‚Üí		canvas.height = imageElement.naturalHeight || src.rows;
    50‚Üí		cv.imshow(canvas, dst);
    51‚Üí		const dataUrl = canvas.toDataURL('image/png');
    52‚Üí
    53‚Üí		// Cleanup
    54‚Üí		channels.delete();
    55‚Üí		alpha.delete();
    56‚Üí
    57‚Üí		return dataUrl;
    58‚Üí	} finally {
    59‚Üí		src.delete();
    60‚Üí		dst.delete();
    61‚Üí	}
    62‚Üí};
    63‚Üí
    64‚Üífunction removeCheckeredPattern(_cv: any, src: any, alpha: any, tolerance: number): void {
    65‚Üí	// Sample corner pixels to detect checkered pattern colors
    66‚Üí	const colors = sampleCheckerColors(src);
    67‚Üí
    68‚Üí	// Remove pixels matching checker pattern
    69‚Üí	for (let y = 0; y < src.rows; y++) {
    70‚Üí		for (let x = 0; x < src.cols; x++) {
    71‚Üí			const pixel = src.ucharPtr(y, x);
    72‚Üí			const r = pixel[0];
    73‚Üí			const g = pixel[1];
    74‚Üí			const b = pixel[2];
    75‚Üí
    76‚Üí			// Check if pixel matches any checker color
    77‚Üí			for (const color of colors) {
    78‚Üí				const diff = Math.abs(r - color.r) + Math.abs(g - color.g) + Math.abs(b - color.b);
    79‚Üí				if (diff < tolerance * 3) {
    80‚Üí					alpha.ucharPtr(y, x)[0] = 0;
    81‚Üí					break;
    82‚Üí				}
    83‚Üí			}
    84‚Üí		}
    85‚Üí	}
    86‚Üí}
    87‚Üí
    88‚Üífunction sampleCheckerColors(src: any): Array<{ r: number; g: number; b: number }> {
    89‚Üí	// Sample pixels from corners and edges to detect pattern
    90‚Üí	const samples: Array<{ r: number; g: number; b: number }> = [];
    91‚Üí	// Note: sample from fixed points; dynamic sample size not used currently
    92‚Üí
    93‚Üí	const samplePoints = [
    94‚Üí		[0, 0],
    95‚Üí		[10, 10],
    96‚Üí		[20, 20],
    97‚Üí		[src.cols - 1, 0],
    98‚Üí		[src.cols - 11, 10],
    99‚Üí		[0, src.rows - 1],
   100‚Üí		[10, src.rows - 11],
   101‚Üí	];
   102‚Üí
   103‚Üí	for (const [x, y] of samplePoints) {
   104‚Üí		if (x >= 0 && x < src.cols && y >= 0 && y < src.rows) {
   105‚Üí			const pixel = src.ucharPtr(y, x);
   106‚Üí			samples.push({ r: pixel[0], g: pixel[1], b: pixel[2] });
   107‚Üí		}
   108‚Üí	}
   109‚Üí
   110‚Üí	// Cluster similar colors
   111‚Üí	const clustered = clusterColors(samples, 15);
   112‚Üí	return clustered;
   113‚Üí}
   114‚Üí
   115‚Üífunction clusterColors(
   116‚Üí	colors: Array<{ r: number; g: number; b: number }>,
   117‚Üí	threshold: number,
   118‚Üí): Array<{ r: number; g: number; b: number }> {
   119‚Üí	if (colors.length === 0) return [];
   120‚Üí
   121‚Üí	const clusters: Array<{ r: number; g: number; b: number }> = [colors[0]];
   122‚Üí
   123‚Üí	for (const color of colors) {
   124‚Üí		let foundCluster = false;
   125‚Üí		for (const cluster of clusters) {
   126‚Üí			const diff = Math.abs(color.r - cluster.r) + Math.abs(color.g - cluster.g) + Math.abs(color.b - cluster.b);
   127‚Üí			if (diff < threshold) {
   128‚Üí				foundCluster = true;
   129‚Üí				break;
   130‚Üí			}
   131‚Üí		}
   132‚Üí		if (!foundCluster) {
   133‚Üí			clusters.push(color);
   134‚Üí		}
   135‚Üí	}
   136‚Üí
   137‚Üí	return clusters;
   138‚Üí}
   139‚Üí
   140‚Üífunction removeSolidBackground(cv: any, src: any, alpha: any, tolerance: number): void {
   141‚Üí	// Sample edge pixels to detect background color
   142‚Üí	const bgColor = detectBackgroundColor(src);
   143‚Üí
   144‚Üí	// Use flood fill from corners - mask must be (rows+2, cols+2) CV_8UC1
   145‚Üí	const mask = new cv.Mat(src.rows + 2, src.cols + 2, cv.CV_8UC1, new cv.Scalar(0));
   146‚Üí	const fillColor = new cv.Scalar(255, 255, 255, 255);
   147‚Üí	const seedPoint = new cv.Point(0, 0);
   148‚Üí
   149‚Üí	// Create mask for flood fill (use loDiff/hiDiff and fixed connectivity)
   150‚Üí	try {
   151‚Üí		cv.floodFill(
   152‚Üí			src,
   153‚Üí			mask,
   154‚Üí			seedPoint,
   155‚Üí			fillColor,
   156‚Üí			new cv.Rect(),
   157‚Üí			new cv.Scalar(tolerance, tolerance, tolerance, 0),
   158‚Üí			new cv.Scalar(tolerance, tolerance, tolerance, 0),
   159‚Üí			4 /* 4-connectivity */,
   160‚Üí		);
   161‚Üí	} catch (e) {
   162‚Üí		// If floodFill fails (e.g., due to format), continue with color-diff approach only
   163‚Üí		console.warn('floodFill failed, continuing with color-diff removal', e);
   164‚Üí	}
   165‚Üí
   166‚Üí	// Remove pixels matching background color
   167‚Üí	for (let y = 0; y < src.rows; y++) {
   168‚Üí		for (let x = 0; x < src.cols; x++) {
   169‚Üí			const pixel = src.ucharPtr(y, x);
   170‚Üí			const r = pixel[0];
   171‚Üí			const g = pixel[1];
   172‚Üí			const b = pixel[2];
   173‚Üí
   174‚Üí			const diff = Math.abs(r - bgColor.r) + Math.abs(g - bgColor.g) + Math.abs(b - bgColor.b);
   175‚Üí			if (diff < tolerance * 3) {
   176‚Üí				alpha.ucharPtr(y, x)[0] = 0;
   177‚Üí			}
   178‚Üí		}
   179‚Üí	}
   180‚Üí
   181‚Üí	mask.delete();
   182‚Üí}
   183‚Üí
   184‚Üífunction detectBackgroundColor(src: any): { r: number; g: number; b: number } {
   185‚Üí	// Sample all four edges to find most common color
   186‚Üí	const edgeSamples: number[][] = [];
   187‚Üí
   188‚Üí	const sampleStep = 5;
   189‚Üí
   190‚Üí	// Top edge
   191‚Üí	for (let x = 0; x < src.cols; x += sampleStep) {
   192‚Üí		const pixel = src.ucharPtr(0, x);
   193‚Üí		edgeSamples.push([pixel[0], pixel[1], pixel[2]]);
   194‚Üí	}
   195‚Üí
   196‚Üí	// Bottom edge
   197‚Üí	for (let x = 0; x < src.cols; x += sampleStep) {
   198‚Üí		const pixel = src.ucharPtr(src.rows - 1, x);
   199‚Üí		edgeSamples.push([pixel[0], pixel[1], pixel[2]]);
   200‚Üí	}
   201‚Üí
   202‚Üí	// Left edge
   203‚Üí	for (let y = 0; y < src.rows; y += sampleStep) {
   204‚Üí		const pixel = src.ucharPtr(y, 0);
   205‚Üí		edgeSamples.push([pixel[0], pixel[1], pixel[2]]);
   206‚Üí	}
   207‚Üí
   208‚Üí	// Right edge
   209‚Üí	for (let y = 0; y < src.rows; y += sampleStep) {
   210‚Üí		const pixel = src.ucharPtr(y, src.cols - 1);
   211‚Üí		edgeSamples.push([pixel[0], pixel[1], pixel[2]]);
   212‚Üí	}
   213‚Üí
   214‚Üí	// Calculate average
   215‚Üí	const avg = edgeSamples.reduce(
   216‚Üí		(acc, color) => ({
   217‚Üí			r: acc.r + color[0],
   218‚Üí			g: acc.g + color[1],
   219‚Üí			b: acc.b + color[2],
   220‚Üí		}),
   221‚Üí		{ r: 0, g: 0, b: 0 },
   222‚Üí	);
   223‚Üí
   224‚Üí	const count = edgeSamples.length;
   225‚Üí	return {
   226‚Üí		r: Math.round(avg.r / count),
   227‚Üí		g: Math.round(avg.g / count),
   228‚Üí		b: Math.round(avg.b / count),
   229‚Üí	};
   230‚Üí}
   231‚Üí
   232‚Üífunction removeShadows(cv: any, src: any, alpha: any, tolerance: number): void {
   233‚Üí	// Convert to HSV to better detect shadows
   234‚Üí	const hsv = new cv.Mat();
   235‚Üí	cv.cvtColor(src, hsv, cv.COLOR_RGBA2RGB);
   236‚Üí	cv.cvtColor(hsv, hsv, cv.COLOR_RGB2HSV);
   237‚Üí
   238‚Üí	// Split channels
   239‚Üí	const channels = new cv.MatVector();
   240‚Üí	cv.split(hsv, channels);
   241‚Üí
   242‚Üí	// Value channel (brightness)
   243‚Üí	const vChannel = channels.get(2);
   244‚Üí
   245‚Üí	// Threshold to find dark regions (shadows)
   246‚Üí	const shadowMask = new cv.Mat();
   247‚Üí	cv.threshold(vChannel, shadowMask, tolerance * 2.5, 255, cv.THRESH_BINARY_INV);
   248‚Üí
   249‚Üí	// Apply morphological operations to clean up
   250‚Üí	const kernel = cv.getStructuringElement(cv.MORPH_ELLIPSE, new cv.Size(5, 5));
   251‚Üí	cv.morphologyEx(shadowMask, shadowMask, cv.MORPH_OPEN, kernel);
   252‚Üí	cv.morphologyEx(shadowMask, shadowMask, cv.MORPH_CLOSE, kernel);
   253‚Üí
   254‚Üí	// Blur to soften edges
   255‚Üí	cv.GaussianBlur(shadowMask, shadowMask, new cv.Size(5, 5), 0);
   256‚Üí
   257‚Üí	// Apply to alpha with feathering
   258‚Üí	for (let y = 0; y < src.rows; y++) {
   259‚Üí		for (let x = 0; x < src.cols; x++) {
   260‚Üí			const shadowValue = shadowMask.ucharPtr(y, x)[0];
   261‚Üí			if (shadowValue > 128) {
   262‚Üí				const currentAlpha = alpha.ucharPtr(y, x)[0];
   263‚Üí				// Gradually reduce alpha based on shadow intensity
   264‚Üí				const newAlpha = Math.floor(currentAlpha * (1 - shadowValue / 255));
   265‚Üí				alpha.ucharPtr(y, x)[0] = newAlpha;
   266‚Üí			}
   267‚Üí		}
   268‚Üí	}
   269‚Üí
   270‚Üí	hsv.delete();
   271‚Üí	channels.delete();
   272‚Üí	vChannel.delete();
   273‚Üí	shadowMask.delete();
   274‚Üí	kernel.delete();
   275‚Üí}
   276‚Üí

<system-reminder>
Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it looks malicious. If it does, you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer high-level questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>

2025-10-07 12:21:53 
     1‚Üíimport React, { useCallback } from 'react';
     2‚Üí
     3‚Üíinterface ImageUploaderProps {
     4‚Üí	onImageLoad: (image: HTMLImageElement, file: File) => void;
     5‚Üí}
     6‚Üí
     ...
 
     1‚Üíimport React, { useCallback } from 'react';
     2‚Üí
     3‚Üíinterface ImageUploaderProps {
     4‚Üí	onImageLoad: (image: HTMLImageElement, file: File) => void;
     5‚Üí}
     6‚Üí
     7‚Üíexport const ImageUploader: React.FC<ImageUploaderProps> = ({ onImageLoad }) => {
     8‚Üí	const handleFileChange = useCallback(
     9‚Üí		(event: React.ChangeEvent<HTMLInputElement>) => {
    10‚Üí			const file = event.target.files?.[0];
    11‚Üí			if (!file) return;
    12‚Üí
    13‚Üí			const reader = new FileReader();
    14‚Üí			reader.onload = (e) => {
    15‚Üí				const img = new Image();
    16‚Üí				img.onload = () => onImageLoad(img, file);
    17‚Üí				img.src = e.target?.result as string;
    18‚Üí			};
    19‚Üí			reader.readAsDataURL(file);
    20‚Üí		},
    21‚Üí		[onImageLoad],
    22‚Üí	);
    23‚Üí
    24‚Üí	const handleDrop = useCallback(
    25‚Üí		(event: React.DragEvent) => {
    26‚Üí			event.preventDefault();
    27‚Üí			const file = event.dataTransfer.files[0];
    28‚Üí			if (file && (file.type === 'image/png' || file.type === 'image/jpeg')) {
    29‚Üí				const reader = new FileReader();
    30‚Üí				reader.onload = (e) => {
    31‚Üí					const img = new Image();
    32‚Üí					img.onload = () => onImageLoad(img, file);
    33‚Üí					img.src = e.target?.result as string;
    34‚Üí				};
    35‚Üí				reader.readAsDataURL(file);
    36‚Üí			}
    37‚Üí		},
    38‚Üí		[onImageLoad],
    39‚Üí	);
    40‚Üí
    41‚Üí	const handleDragOver = (event: React.DragEvent) => {
    42‚Üí		event.preventDefault();
    43‚Üí	};
    44‚Üí
    45‚Üí	return (
    46‚Üí		<div
    47‚Üí			onDrop={handleDrop}
    48‚Üí			onDragOver={handleDragOver}
    49‚Üí			className="border-2 border-dashed border-gray-300 rounded-lg p-8 md:p-10 text-center hover:border-blue-500 hover:bg-blue-50 transition-all duration-200 cursor-pointer group">
    50‚Üí			<input
    51‚Üí				type="file"
    52‚Üí				accept="image/png,image/jpeg"
    53‚Üí				onChange={handleFileChange}
    54‚Üí				className="hidden"
    55‚Üí				id="file-upload"
    56‚Üí			/>
    57‚Üí			<label
    58‚Üí				htmlFor="file-upload"
    59‚Üí				className="cursor-pointer block">
    60‚Üí				<div className="space-y-3">
    61‚Üí					<svg
    62‚Üí						className="mx-auto h-12 w-12 md:h-14 md:w-14 text-gray-400 group-hover:text-blue-500 transition-colors"
    63‚Üí						stroke="currentColor"
    64‚Üí						fill="none"
    65‚Üí						viewBox="0 0 48 48">
    66‚Üí						<path
    67‚Üí							d="M28 8H12a4 4 0 00-4 4v20m32-12v8m0 0v8a4 4 0 01-4 4H12a4 4 0 01-4-4v-4m32-4l-3.172-3.172a4 4 0 00-5.656 0L28 28M8 32l9.172-9.172a4 4 0 015.656 0L28 28m0 0l4 4m4-24h8m-4-4v8m-12 4h.02"
    68‚Üí							strokeWidth={2}
    69‚Üí							strokeLinecap="round"
    70‚Üí							strokeLinejoin="round"
    71‚Üí						/>
    72‚Üí					</svg>
    73‚Üí					<div className="space-y-1">
    74‚Üí						<div className="text-gray-600">
    75‚Üí							<span className="font-semibold text-blue-600 group-hover:text-blue-700 transition-colors">
    76‚Üí								Click to upload
    77‚Üí							</span>{' '}
    78‚Üí							or drag and drop
    79‚Üí						</div>
    80‚Üí						<p className="text-xs md:text-sm text-gray-500">PNG or JPG files (max 10MB)</p>
    81‚Üí					</div>
    82‚Üí				</div>
    83‚Üí			</label>
    84‚Üí		</div>
    85‚Üí	);
    86‚Üí};
    87‚Üí

üõ†Ô∏è Tool Use: Write (Id: Toolu_01Nplm3Mq6Dnbzl3Aqye6Bkk)
2025-10-07 12:22:23 
{
  "file_path": "/Users/jagzviruz/projects/personal/remove-bg/CLAUDE.md",
  "content": "# CLAUDE.md\n\nThis file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) w...
 
{
  "file_path": "/Users/jagzviruz/projects/personal/remove-bg/CLAUDE.md",
  "content": "# CLAUDE.md\n\nThis file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with code in this repository.\n\n## Project Overview\n\nA client-side React application that removes checkered patterns and solid backgrounds from images using OpenCV.js. All image processing happens entirely in the browser using WebAssembly - no images are uploaded to any server.\n\n## Development Commands\n\n```bash\n# Install dependencies\nnpm install\n\n# Start development server (runs on localhost:5173 by default)\nnpm run dev\n\n# Build for production\nnpm run build\n\n# Preview production build\nnpm run preview\n\n# Run linter\nnpm run lint\n```\n\n## Architecture\n\n### Core Processing Flow\n\nThe application follows this flow:\n1. User uploads image via `ImageUploader` component\n2. Image is loaded into browser memory as `HTMLImageElement`\n3. User configures processing options in `ProcessingControls`\n4. `processImage()` in `src/utils/imageProcessor.ts` performs OpenCV operations\n5. Result is displayed in `ResultModal` with download/crop options\n\n### Key Components\n\n**App.tsx** (`src/App.tsx`)\n- Main application component wrapped in `OpenCvProvider`\n- Manages state for original image, processed image, and processing options\n- Coordinates image upload, processing, and result display\n- OpenCV loading happens via `useOpenCv()` hook from `opencv-react-ts`\n\n**Image Processing** (`src/utils/imageProcessor.ts`)\n- Core processing logic using OpenCV.js\n- Three removal strategies:\n  - **Checkered pattern removal**: Samples corner pixels to detect pattern colors, removes matching pixels\n  - **Solid background removal**: Uses edge sampling + flood fill to detect and remove dominant background\n  - **Shadow removal**: Converts to HSV color space, detects dark regions via V-channel thresholding\n- All operations work on Mat objects and manipulate alpha channel directly\n- Memory management: Always delete OpenCV Mat objects after use to prevent leaks\n\n**Components**\n- `ImageUploader`: Handles file upload via input or drag-and-drop\n- `ProcessingControls`: UI for checkboxes (removeCheckered, removeSolid, removeShadow) and tolerance slider\n- `ResultModal`: Displays processed image with crop and download functionality\n\n### State Management\n\nAll state is managed locally in `App.tsx` using React hooks:\n- `originalImage`: HTMLImageElement of uploaded image\n- `processedImage`: Base64 data URL of processed result\n- `options`: ProcessingOptions object (boolean flags + tolerance number)\n- `processing`: Boolean flag to show loading state\n- OpenCV loaded state comes from `useOpenCv()` hook\n\n### Image Processing Details\n\n**Color matching tolerance**: The `tolerance` option (5-50) controls color difference threshold. Formula: `Math.abs(r1-r2) + Math.abs(g1-g2) + Math.abs(b1-b2) < tolerance * 3`\n\n**OpenCV Mat lifecycle**:\n- Create Mat from HTMLImageElement via `cv.imread()`\n- Convert to RGBA if needed\n- Create separate alpha channel (CV_8UC1)\n- Apply processing functions that modify alpha\n- Merge channels and export via canvas.toDataURL()\n- CRITICAL: Delete all Mat objects to avoid memory leaks\n\n**Background detection**: Edge sampling strategy - samples pixels from all four edges at intervals, averages to find dominant background color\n\n## Deployment\n\nGitHub Actions workflow deploys to GitHub Pages on push to main:\n- Build runs `npm ci` and `npm run build`\n- Outputs to `dist/` directory\n- Deploys to `https://jagadish-k.github.io/bg-remover/`\n\n## Tech Stack\n\n- React 19 with TypeScript\n- Vite (build tool and dev server)\n- TailwindCSS 4 for styling\n- OpenCV.js via `opencv-react-ts` wrapper\n- ESLint with TypeScript and React plugins\n"
}
üõ†Ô∏è Tool Use: Write (Id: Toolu_01Nplm3Mq6Dnbzl3Aqye6Bkk)
2025-10-07 12:22:23 
{
  "file_path": "/Users/jagzviruz/projects/personal/remove-bg/CLAUDE.md",
  "content": "# CLAUDE.md\n\nThis file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) w...
 
{
  "file_path": "/Users/jagzviruz/projects/personal/remove-bg/CLAUDE.md",
  "content": "# CLAUDE.md\n\nThis file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with code in this repository.\n\n## Project Overview\n\nA client-side React application that removes checkered patterns and solid backgrounds from images using OpenCV.js. All image processing happens entirely in the browser using WebAssembly - no images are uploaded to any server.\n\n## Development Commands\n\n```bash\n# Install dependencies\nnpm install\n\n# Start development server (runs on localhost:5173 by default)\nnpm run dev\n\n# Build for production\nnpm run build\n\n# Preview production build\nnpm run preview\n\n# Run linter\nnpm run lint\n```\n\n## Architecture\n\n### Core Processing Flow\n\nThe application follows this flow:\n1. User uploads image via `ImageUploader` component\n2. Image is loaded into browser memory as `HTMLImageElement`\n3. User configures processing options in `ProcessingControls`\n4. `processImage()` in `src/utils/imageProcessor.ts` performs OpenCV operations\n5. Result is displayed in `ResultModal` with download/crop options\n\n### Key Components\n\n**App.tsx** (`src/App.tsx`)\n- Main application component wrapped in `OpenCvProvider`\n- Manages state for original image, processed image, and processing options\n- Coordinates image upload, processing, and result display\n- OpenCV loading happens via `useOpenCv()` hook from `opencv-react-ts`\n\n**Image Processing** (`src/utils/imageProcessor.ts`)\n- Core processing logic using OpenCV.js\n- Three removal strategies:\n  - **Checkered pattern removal**: Samples corner pixels to detect pattern colors, removes matching pixels\n  - **Solid background removal**: Uses edge sampling + flood fill to detect and remove dominant background\n  - **Shadow removal**: Converts to HSV color space, detects dark regions via V-channel thresholding\n- All operations work on Mat objects and manipulate alpha channel directly\n- Memory management: Always delete OpenCV Mat objects after use to prevent leaks\n\n**Components**\n- `ImageUploader`: Handles file upload via input or drag-and-drop\n- `ProcessingControls`: UI for checkboxes (removeCheckered, removeSolid, removeShadow) and tolerance slider\n- `ResultModal`: Displays processed image with crop and download functionality\n\n### State Management\n\nAll state is managed locally in `App.tsx` using React hooks:\n- `originalImage`: HTMLImageElement of uploaded image\n- `processedImage`: Base64 data URL of processed result\n- `options`: ProcessingOptions object (boolean flags + tolerance number)\n- `processing`: Boolean flag to show loading state\n- OpenCV loaded state comes from `useOpenCv()` hook\n\n### Image Processing Details\n\n**Color matching tolerance**: The `tolerance` option (5-50) controls color difference threshold. Formula: `Math.abs(r1-r2) + Math.abs(g1-g2) + Math.abs(b1-b2) < tolerance * 3`\n\n**OpenCV Mat lifecycle**:\n- Create Mat from HTMLImageElement via `cv.imread()`\n- Convert to RGBA if needed\n- Create separate alpha channel (CV_8UC1)\n- Apply processing functions that modify alpha\n- Merge channels and export via canvas.toDataURL()\n- CRITICAL: Delete all Mat objects to avoid memory leaks\n\n**Background detection**: Edge sampling strategy - samples pixels from all four edges at intervals, averages to find dominant background color\n\n## Deployment\n\nGitHub Actions workflow deploys to GitHub Pages on push to main:\n- Build runs `npm ci` and `npm run build`\n- Outputs to `dist/` directory\n- Deploys to `https://jagadish-k.github.io/bg-remover/`\n\n## Tech Stack\n\n- React 19 with TypeScript\n- Vite (build tool and dev server)\n- TailwindCSS 4 for styling\n- OpenCV.js via `opencv-react-ts` wrapper\n- ESLint with TypeScript and React plugins\n"
}

üß∞ Tool Result: Toolu_01Kaaa7Je9A3Ade7Qmvxebaz
2025-10-07 12:26:45 
     1‚Üíimport React, { useEffect, useMemo, useState } from 'react';
     2‚Üí
     3‚Üíinterface ResultModalProps {
     4‚Üí	imageSrc: string;
     5‚Üí	open: boolean;
     6‚Üí	onClose: () => voi...
 
     1‚Üíimport React, { useEffect, useMemo, useState } from 'react';
     2‚Üí
     3‚Üíinterface ResultModalProps {
     4‚Üí	imageSrc: string;
     5‚Üí	open: boolean;
     6‚Üí	onClose: () => void;
     7‚Üí	onDownload: (croppedDataUrl?: string) => void;
     8‚Üí}
     9‚Üí
    10‚Üíexport const ResultModal: React.FC<ResultModalProps> = ({ imageSrc, open, onClose, onDownload }) => {
    11‚Üí	const [crop, setCrop] = useState({ left: 0, right: 0, top: 0, bottom: 0 });
    12‚Üí	const [previewUrl, setPreviewUrl] = useState(imageSrc);
    13‚Üí	const [imgSize, setImgSize] = useState<{ w: number; h: number }>({ w: 0, h: 0 });
    14‚Üí
    15‚Üí	// Reset state when a new image opens
    16‚Üí	useEffect(() => {
    17‚Üí		if (!imageSrc) return;
    18‚Üí		setPreviewUrl(imageSrc);
    19‚Üí		setCrop({ left: 0, right: 0, top: 0, bottom: 0 });
    20‚Üí		const img = new Image();
    21‚Üí		img.src = imageSrc;
    22‚Üí		img.onload = () => setImgSize({ w: img.naturalWidth, h: img.naturalHeight });
    23‚Üí	}, [imageSrc]);
    24‚Üí
    25‚Üí	const maxLeft = useMemo(() => Math.max(0, imgSize.w - crop.right - 1), [imgSize.w, crop.right]);
    26‚Üí	const maxRight = useMemo(() => Math.max(0, imgSize.w - crop.left - 1), [imgSize.w, crop.left]);
    27‚Üí	const maxTop = useMemo(() => Math.max(0, imgSize.h - crop.bottom - 1), [imgSize.h, crop.bottom]);
    28‚Üí	const maxBottom = useMemo(() => Math.max(0, imgSize.h - crop.top - 1), [imgSize.h, crop.top]);
    29‚Üí
    30‚Üí	// Dynamic crop bounds
    31‚Üí	const handleCropChange = (e: React.ChangeEvent<HTMLInputElement>) => {
    32‚Üí		const { name, value } = e.target;
    33‚Üí		const n = Math.max(0, Number(value) || 0);
    34‚Üí		setCrop((prev) => {
    35‚Üí			const next = { ...prev } as any;
    36‚Üí			if (name === 'left') next.left = Math.min(n, Math.max(0, imgSize.w - prev.right - 1));
    37‚Üí			if (name === 'right') next.right = Math.min(n, Math.max(0, imgSize.w - prev.left - 1));
    38‚Üí			if (name === 'top') next.top = Math.min(n, Math.max(0, imgSize.h - prev.bottom - 1));
    39‚Üí			if (name === 'bottom') next.bottom = Math.min(n, Math.max(0, imgSize.h - prev.top - 1));
    40‚Üí			return next;
    41‚Üí		});
    42‚Üí	};
    43‚Üí
    44‚Üí	// Apply crop to image
    45‚Üí	const handleApplyCrop = () => {
    46‚Üí		const img = new Image();
    47‚Üí		img.src = imageSrc;
    48‚Üí		img.onload = () => {
    49‚Üí			const w = Math.max(1, img.width - crop.left - crop.right);
    50‚Üí			const h = Math.max(1, img.height - crop.top - crop.bottom);
    51‚Üí			const canvas = document.createElement('canvas');
    52‚Üí			canvas.width = w;
    53‚Üí			canvas.height = h;
    54‚Üí			const ctx = canvas.getContext('2d');
    55‚Üí			if (ctx) {
    56‚Üí				ctx.drawImage(img, crop.left, crop.top, w, h, 0, 0, w, h);
    57‚Üí				setPreviewUrl(canvas.toDataURL('image/png'));
    58‚Üí			}
    59‚Üí		};
    60‚Üí	};
    61‚Üí
    62‚Üí	const canApplyCrop = useMemo(() => {
    63‚Üí		const w = imgSize.w - crop.left - crop.right;
    64‚Üí		const h = imgSize.h - crop.top - crop.bottom;
    65‚Üí		return w > 0 && h > 0;
    66‚Üí	}, [imgSize, crop]);
    67‚Üí
    68‚Üí	// Reset crop to initial state
    69‚Üí	const resetCrop = () => setCrop({ left: 0, right: 0, top: 0, bottom: 0 });
    70‚Üí
    71‚Üí	const handleDownloadClick = () => onDownload(previewUrl);
    72‚Üí
    73‚Üí	if (!open) return null;
    74‚Üí
    75‚Üí	return (
    76‚Üí		<div className="fixed inset-0 z-50 flex items-center justify-center bg-black bg-opacity-60">
    77‚Üí			<div className="bg-white rounded-lg shadow-xl p-6 max-w-2xl w-full relative">
    78‚Üí				<button
    79‚Üí					className="absolute top-2 right-2 text-gray-500 hover:text-gray-800"
    80‚Üí					onClick={onClose}>
    81‚Üí					&times;
    82‚Üí				</button>
    83‚Üí				<h2 className="text-xl font-bold mb-4 text-center">Processed Image</h2>
    84‚Üí				<div className="flex flex-col md:flex-row gap-6 items-center">
    85‚Üí					<div className="flex-1 flex justify-center">
    86‚Üí						<img
    87‚Üí							src={previewUrl}
    88‚Üí							alt="Processed"
    89‚Üí							className="max-h-96 rounded-lg border object-contain"
    90‚Üí						/>
    91‚Üí					</div>
    92‚Üí					<div className="flex-1 w-full">
    93‚Üí						<h3 className="font-semibold mb-2">Crop Edges</h3>
    94‚Üí						<div className="grid grid-cols-2 gap-3 mb-4 text-sm">
    95‚Üí							<label className="text-sm flex items-center justify-between">
    96‚Üí								<span>Left</span>
    97‚Üí								<input
    98‚Üí									type="number"
    99‚Üí									name="left"
   100‚Üí									min={0}
   101‚Üí									max={maxLeft}
   102‚Üí									value={crop.left}
   103‚Üí									onChange={handleCropChange}
   104‚Üí									className="ml-2 w-24 border rounded px-2 py-1"
   105‚Üí								/>
   106‚Üí							</label>
   107‚Üí							<label className="text-sm flex items-center justify-between">
   108‚Üí								<span>Right</span>
   109‚Üí								<input
   110‚Üí									type="number"
   111‚Üí									name="right"
   112‚Üí									min={0}
   113‚Üí									max={maxRight}
   114‚Üí									value={crop.right}
   115‚Üí									onChange={handleCropChange}
   116‚Üí									className="ml-2 w-24 border rounded px-2 py-1"
   117‚Üí								/>
   118‚Üí							</label>
   119‚Üí							<label className="text-sm flex items-center justify-between">
   120‚Üí								<span>Top</span>
   121‚Üí								<input
   122‚Üí									type="number"
   123‚Üí									name="top"
   124‚Üí									min={0}
   125‚Üí									max={maxTop}
   126‚Üí									value={crop.top}
   127‚Üí									onChange={handleCropChange}
   128‚Üí									className="ml-2 w-24 border rounded px-2 py-1"
   129‚Üí								/>
   130‚Üí							</label>
   131‚Üí							<label className="text-sm flex items-center justify-between">
   132‚Üí								<span>Bottom</span>
   133‚Üí								<input
   134‚Üí									type="number"
   135‚Üí									name="bottom"
   136‚Üí									min={0}
   137‚Üí									max={maxBottom}
   138‚Üí									value={crop.bottom}
   139‚Üí									onChange={handleCropChange}
   140‚Üí									className="ml-2 w-24 border rounded px-2 py-1"
   141‚Üí								/>
   142‚Üí							</label>
   143‚Üí						</div>
   144‚Üí						<div className="flex flex-wrap gap-2 items-center">
   145‚Üí							<button
   146‚Üí								onClick={handleApplyCrop}
   147‚Üí								disabled={!canApplyCrop}
   148‚Üí								className="bg-blue-600 text-white px-4 py-2 rounded-lg disabled:bg-gray-300">
   149‚Üí								Apply Crop
   150‚Üí							</button>
   151‚Üí							<button
   152‚Üí								onClick={resetCrop}
   153‚Üí								className="bg-gray-100 text-gray-800 px-4 py-2 rounded-lg border">
   154‚Üí								Reset
   155‚Üí							</button>
   156‚Üí							<button
   157‚Üí								onClick={handleDownloadClick}
   158‚Üí								className="bg-green-600 text-white px-4 py-2 rounded-lg">
   159‚Üí								Download PNG
   160‚Üí							</button>
   161‚Üí						</div>
   162‚Üí					</div>
   163‚Üí				</div>
   164‚Üí			</div>
   165‚Üí		</div>
   166‚Üí	);
   167‚Üí};
   168‚Üí

Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it looks malicious. If it does, you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer high-level questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>
üß∞ Tool Result: Toolu_01Kaaa7Je9A3Ade7Qmvxebaz
2025-10-07 12:26:45 
     1‚Üíimport React, { useEffect, useMemo, useState } from 'react';
     2‚Üí
     3‚Üíinterface ResultModalProps {
     4‚Üí	imageSrc: string;
     5‚Üí	open: boolean;
     6‚Üí	onClose: () => voi...
 
     1‚Üíimport React, { useEffect, useMemo, useState } from 'react';
     2‚Üí
     3‚Üíinterface ResultModalProps {
     4‚Üí	imageSrc: string;
     5‚Üí	open: boolean;
     6‚Üí	onClose: () => void;
     7‚Üí	onDownload: (croppedDataUrl?: string) => void;
     8‚Üí}
     9‚Üí
    10‚Üíexport const ResultModal: React.FC<ResultModalProps> = ({ imageSrc, open, onClose, onDownload }) => {
    11‚Üí	const [crop, setCrop] = useState({ left: 0, right: 0, top: 0, bottom: 0 });
    12‚Üí	const [previewUrl, setPreviewUrl] = useState(imageSrc);
    13‚Üí	const [imgSize, setImgSize] = useState<{ w: number; h: number }>({ w: 0, h: 0 });
    14‚Üí
    15‚Üí	// Reset state when a new image opens
    16‚Üí	useEffect(() => {
    17‚Üí		if (!imageSrc) return;
    18‚Üí		setPreviewUrl(imageSrc);
    19‚Üí		setCrop({ left: 0, right: 0, top: 0, bottom: 0 });
    20‚Üí		const img = new Image();
    21‚Üí		img.src = imageSrc;
    22‚Üí		img.onload = () => setImgSize({ w: img.naturalWidth, h: img.naturalHeight });
    23‚Üí	}, [imageSrc]);
    24‚Üí
    25‚Üí	const maxLeft = useMemo(() => Math.max(0, imgSize.w - crop.right - 1), [imgSize.w, crop.right]);
    26‚Üí	const maxRight = useMemo(() => Math.max(0, imgSize.w - crop.left - 1), [imgSize.w, crop.left]);
    27‚Üí	const maxTop = useMemo(() => Math.max(0, imgSize.h - crop.bottom - 1), [imgSize.h, crop.bottom]);
    28‚Üí	const maxBottom = useMemo(() => Math.max(0, imgSize.h - crop.top - 1), [imgSize.h, crop.top]);
    29‚Üí
    30‚Üí	// Dynamic crop bounds
    31‚Üí	const handleCropChange = (e: React.ChangeEvent<HTMLInputElement>) => {
    32‚Üí		const { name, value } = e.target;
    33‚Üí		const n = Math.max(0, Number(value) || 0);
    34‚Üí		setCrop((prev) => {
    35‚Üí			const next = { ...prev } as any;
    36‚Üí			if (name === 'left') next.left = Math.min(n, Math.max(0, imgSize.w - prev.right - 1));
    37‚Üí			if (name === 'right') next.right = Math.min(n, Math.max(0, imgSize.w - prev.left - 1));
    38‚Üí			if (name === 'top') next.top = Math.min(n, Math.max(0, imgSize.h - prev.bottom - 1));
    39‚Üí			if (name === 'bottom') next.bottom = Math.min(n, Math.max(0, imgSize.h - prev.top - 1));
    40‚Üí			return next;
    41‚Üí		});
    42‚Üí	};
    43‚Üí
    44‚Üí	// Apply crop to image
    45‚Üí	const handleApplyCrop = () => {
    46‚Üí		const img = new Image();
    47‚Üí		img.src = imageSrc;
    48‚Üí		img.onload = () => {
    49‚Üí			const w = Math.max(1, img.width - crop.left - crop.right);
    50‚Üí			const h = Math.max(1, img.height - crop.top - crop.bottom);
    51‚Üí			const canvas = document.createElement('canvas');
    52‚Üí			canvas.width = w;
    53‚Üí			canvas.height = h;
    54‚Üí			const ctx = canvas.getContext('2d');
    55‚Üí			if (ctx) {
    56‚Üí				ctx.drawImage(img, crop.left, crop.top, w, h, 0, 0, w, h);
    57‚Üí				setPreviewUrl(canvas.toDataURL('image/png'));
    58‚Üí			}
    59‚Üí		};
    60‚Üí	};
    61‚Üí
    62‚Üí	const canApplyCrop = useMemo(() => {
    63‚Üí		const w = imgSize.w - crop.left - crop.right;
    64‚Üí		const h = imgSize.h - crop.top - crop.bottom;
    65‚Üí		return w > 0 && h > 0;
    66‚Üí	}, [imgSize, crop]);
    67‚Üí
    68‚Üí	// Reset crop to initial state
    69‚Üí	const resetCrop = () => setCrop({ left: 0, right: 0, top: 0, bottom: 0 });
    70‚Üí
    71‚Üí	const handleDownloadClick = () => onDownload(previewUrl);
    72‚Üí
    73‚Üí	if (!open) return null;
    74‚Üí
    75‚Üí	return (
    76‚Üí		<div className="fixed inset-0 z-50 flex items-center justify-center bg-black bg-opacity-60">
    77‚Üí			<div className="bg-white rounded-lg shadow-xl p-6 max-w-2xl w-full relative">
    78‚Üí				<button
    79‚Üí					className="absolute top-2 right-2 text-gray-500 hover:text-gray-800"
    80‚Üí					onClick={onClose}>
    81‚Üí					&times;
    82‚Üí				</button>
    83‚Üí				<h2 className="text-xl font-bold mb-4 text-center">Processed Image</h2>
    84‚Üí				<div className="flex flex-col md:flex-row gap-6 items-center">
    85‚Üí					<div className="flex-1 flex justify-center">
    86‚Üí						<img
    87‚Üí							src={previewUrl}
    88‚Üí							alt="Processed"
    89‚Üí							className="max-h-96 rounded-lg border object-contain"
    90‚Üí						/>
    91‚Üí					</div>
    92‚Üí					<div className="flex-1 w-full">
    93‚Üí						<h3 className="font-semibold mb-2">Crop Edges</h3>
    94‚Üí						<div className="grid grid-cols-2 gap-3 mb-4 text-sm">
    95‚Üí							<label className="text-sm flex items-center justify-between">
    96‚Üí								<span>Left</span>
    97‚Üí								<input
    98‚Üí									type="number"
    99‚Üí									name="left"
   100‚Üí									min={0}
   101‚Üí									max={maxLeft}
   102‚Üí									value={crop.left}
   103‚Üí									onChange={handleCropChange}
   104‚Üí									className="ml-2 w-24 border rounded px-2 py-1"
   105‚Üí								/>
   106‚Üí							</label>
   107‚Üí							<label className="text-sm flex items-center justify-between">
   108‚Üí								<span>Right</span>
   109‚Üí								<input
   110‚Üí									type="number"
   111‚Üí									name="right"
   112‚Üí									min={0}
   113‚Üí									max={maxRight}
   114‚Üí									value={crop.right}
   115‚Üí									onChange={handleCropChange}
   116‚Üí									className="ml-2 w-24 border rounded px-2 py-1"
   117‚Üí								/>
   118‚Üí							</label>
   119‚Üí							<label className="text-sm flex items-center justify-between">
   120‚Üí								<span>Top</span>
   121‚Üí								<input
   122‚Üí									type="number"
   123‚Üí									name="top"
   124‚Üí									min={0}
   125‚Üí									max={maxTop}
   126‚Üí									value={crop.top}
   127‚Üí									onChange={handleCropChange}
   128‚Üí									className="ml-2 w-24 border rounded px-2 py-1"
   129‚Üí								/>
   130‚Üí							</label>
   131‚Üí							<label className="text-sm flex items-center justify-between">
   132‚Üí								<span>Bottom</span>
   133‚Üí								<input
   134‚Üí									type="number"
   135‚Üí									name="bottom"
   136‚Üí									min={0}
   137‚Üí									max={maxBottom}
   138‚Üí									value={crop.bottom}
   139‚Üí									onChange={handleCropChange}
   140‚Üí									className="ml-2 w-24 border rounded px-2 py-1"
   141‚Üí								/>
   142‚Üí							</label>
   143‚Üí						</div>
   144‚Üí						<div className="flex flex-wrap gap-2 items-center">
   145‚Üí							<button
   146‚Üí								onClick={handleApplyCrop}
   147‚Üí								disabled={!canApplyCrop}
   148‚Üí								className="bg-blue-600 text-white px-4 py-2 rounded-lg disabled:bg-gray-300">
   149‚Üí								Apply Crop
   150‚Üí							</button>
   151‚Üí							<button
   152‚Üí								onClick={resetCrop}
   153‚Üí								className="bg-gray-100 text-gray-800 px-4 py-2 rounded-lg border">
   154‚Üí								Reset
   155‚Üí							</button>
   156‚Üí							<button
   157‚Üí								onClick={handleDownloadClick}
   158‚Üí								className="bg-green-600 text-white px-4 py-2 rounded-lg">
   159‚Üí								Download PNG
   160‚Üí							</button>
   161‚Üí						</div>
   162‚Üí					</div>
   163‚Üí				</div>
   164‚Üí			</div>
   165‚Üí		</div>
   166‚Üí	);
   167‚Üí};
   168‚Üí

<system-reminder>

</system-reminder>

image...</p>\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t</div>\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t)}\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t</div>\n\t\t\t\t\t\t)}\n\t\t\t\t\t</section>\n\t\t\t\t\t{/* Right: Controls/tips (only after image is selected) className=\"bg-blue-50 border border-blue-200 rounded-xl p-4 w-full max-w-md mt-8\">\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<h4 className=\"font-semibold text-blue-900 mb-2 text-sm\">Tips:</h4>\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<ul
