                2025-10-07 13:04:34
                
            

        

        

    

        
            
{
  "file_path": "/Users/jagzviruz/projects/personal/remove-bg/src/utils/imageProcessor.ts",
  "old_string": "function removeCheckeredPattern(cv: any, src: any, alph...

        
        

            
{
  "file_path": "/Users/jagzviruz/projects/personal/remove-bg/src/utils/imageProcessor.ts",
  "old_string": "function removeCheckeredPattern(cv: any, src: any, alpha: any, tolerance: number): void {\n\t// Sample corner pixels to detect checkered pattern colors\n\tconst colors = sampleCheckerColors(src);\n\n\t// Create a mask to track which pixels to remove using flood fill\n\tconst mask = new cv.Mat(src.rows + 2, src.cols + 2, cv.CV_8UC1, new cv.Scalar(0));\n\tconst tempSrc = src.clone();\n\n\t// Flood fill from corners and edges to find continuous background regions\n\tconst seedPoints = [\n\t\tnew cv.Point(0, 0),\n\t\tnew cv.Point(src.cols - 1, 0),\n\t\tnew cv.Point(0, src.rows - 1),\n\t\tnew cv.Point(src.cols - 1, src.rows - 1),\n\t\tnew cv.Point(Math.floor(src.cols / 2), 0),\n\t\tnew cv.Point(Math.floor(src.cols / 2), src.rows - 1),\n\t\tnew cv.Point(0, Math.floor(src.rows / 2)),\n\t\tnew cv.Point(src.cols - 1, Math.floor(src.rows / 2)),\n\t];\n\n\ttry {\n\t\tfor (const seedPoint of seedPoints) {\n\t\t\tif (seedPoint.x < 0 || seedPoint.x >= src.cols || seedPoint.y < 0 || seedPoint.y >= src.rows) continue;\n\n\t\t\tconst pixel = tempSrc.ucharPtr(seedPoint.y, seedPoint.x);\n\t\t\tconst r = pixel[0];\n\t\t\tconst g = pixel[1];\n\t\t\tconst b = pixel[2];\n\n\t\t\t// Check if this seed point matches any checker color\n\t\t\tlet matchesChecker = false;\n\t\t\tfor (const color of colors) {\n\t\t\t\tconst diff = Math.abs(r - color.r) + Math.abs(g - color.g) + Math.abs(b - color.b);\n\t\t\t\tif (diff < tolerance * 3) {\n\t\t\t\t\tmatchesChecker = true;\n\t\t\t\t\tbreak;\n\t\t\t\t}\n\t\t\t}\n\n\t\t\tif (matchesChecker) {\n\t\t\t\t// Flood fill from this point\n\t\t\t\tcv.floodFill(\n\t\t\t\t\ttempSrc,\n\t\t\t\t\tmask,\n\t\t\t\t\tseedPoint,\n\t\t\t\t\tnew cv.Scalar(255, 0, 255, 255), // Magenta marker\n\t\t\t\t\tnew cv.Rect(),\n\t\t\t\t\tnew cv.Scalar(tolerance, tolerance, tolerance, 0),\n\t\t\t\t\tnew cv.Scalar(tolerance, tolerance, tolerance, 0),\n\t\t\t\t\tcv.FLOODFILL_MASK_ONLY | (255 << 8)\n\t\t\t\t);\n\t\t\t}\n\t\t}\n\n\t\t// Apply the mask to alpha channel\n\t\tfor (let y = 0; y < src.rows; y++) {\n\t\t\tfor (let x = 0; x < src.cols; x++) {\n\t\t\t\tconst maskValue = mask.ucharPtr(y + 1, x + 1)[0];\n\t\t\t\tif (maskValue === 255) {\n\t\t\t\t\talpha.ucharPtr(y, x)[0] = 0;\n\t\t\t\t}\n\t\t\t}\n\t\t}\n\t} catch (e) {\n\t\tconsole.warn('Checkered pattern removal failed:', e);\n\t} finally {\n\t\tmask.delete();\n\t\ttempSrc.delete();\n\t}\n}",
  "new_string": "function removeCheckeredPattern(cv: any, src: any, alpha: any, tolerance: number): void {\n\t// Sample corner pixels to detect checkered pattern colors\n\tconst colors = sampleCheckerColors(src);\n\tif (colors.length === 0) return;\n\n\t// Create a visited mask to track which pixels we've already processed\n\tconst visited = new Array(src.rows).fill(0).map(() => new Array(src.cols).fill(false));\n\n\t// Seed points to start flood fill from (edges)\n\tconst seedPoints = [\n\t\t{ x: 0, y: 0 },\n\t\t{ x: src.cols - 1, y: 0 },\n\t\t{ x: 0, y: src.rows - 1 },\n\t\t{ x: src.cols - 1, y: src.rows - 1 },\n\t\t{ x: Math.floor(src.cols / 2), y: 0 },\n\t\t{ x: Math.floor(src.cols / 2), y: src.rows - 1 },\n\t\t{ x: 0, y: Math.floor(src.rows / 2) },\n\t\t{ x: src.cols - 1, y: Math.floor(src.rows / 2) },\n\t];\n\n\t// Flood fill from each seed point\n\tfor (const seedPoint of seedPoints) {\n\t\tif (seedPoint.x < 0 || seedPoint.x >= src.cols || seedPoint.y < 0 || seedPoint.y >= src.rows) continue;\n\t\tif (visited[seedPoint.y][seedPoint.x]) continue;\n\n\t\tconst pixel = src.ucharPtr(seedPoint.y, seedPoint.x);\n\t\tconst seedR = pixel[0];\n\t\tconst seedG = pixel[1];\n\t\tconst seedB = pixel[2];\n\n\t\t// Check if seed matches any checker color\n\t\tlet matchesChecker = false;\n\t\tfor (const color of colors) {\n\t\t\tconst diff = Math.abs(seedR - color.r) + Math.abs(seedG - color.g) + Math.abs(seedB - color.b);\n\t\t\tif (diff < tolerance * 3) {\n\t\t\t\tmatchesChecker = true;\n\t\t\t\tbreak;\n\t\t\t}\n\t\t}\n\n\t\tif (matchesChecker) {\n\t\t\t// Magic wand style flood fill\n\t\t\tmagicWandFill(src, alpha, visited, seedPoint.x, seedPoint.y, seedR, seedG, seedB, tolerance);\n\t\t}\n\t}\n}\n\nfunction magicWandFill(\n\tsrc: any,\n\talpha: any,\n\tvisited: boolean[][],\n\tstartX: number,\n\tstartY: number,\n\ttargetR: number,\n\ttargetG: number,\n\ttargetB: number,\n\ttolerance: number\n): void {\n\tconst stack = [{ x: startX, y: startY }];\n\tconst rows = src.rows;\n\tconst cols = src.cols;\n\n\twhile (stack.length > 0) {\n\t\tconst { x, y } = stack.pop()!;\n\n\t\t// Bounds check\n\t\tif (x < 0 || x >= cols || y < 0 || y >= rows) continue;\n\t\tif (visited[y][x]) continue;\n\n\t\tconst pixel = src.ucharPtr(y, x);\n\t\tconst r = pixel[0];\n\t\tconst g = pixel[1];\n\t\tconst b = pixel[2];\n\n\t\t// Color similarity check\n\t\tconst diff = Math.abs(r - targetR) + Math.abs(g - targetG) + Math.abs(b - targetB);\n\t\tif (diff > tolerance * 3) continue;\n\n\t\t// Mark as visited and transparent\n\t\tvisited[y][x] = true;\n\t\talpha.ucharPtr(y, x)[0] = 0;\n\n\t\t// Add neighbors to stack (4-connectivity)\n\t\tstack.push({ x: x + 1, y });\n\t\tstack.push({ x: x - 1, y });\n\t\tstack.push({ x, y: y + 1 });\n\t\tstack.push({ x, y: y - 1 });\n\t}\n}"
}

1, 0),\n\t\tnew cv.Point(0, src.rows - 1),\n\t\tnew cv.Point(src.cols - 1, src.rows - 1),\n\t\tnew cv.Point(Math.floor(src.cols / 2), 0),\n\t\tnew cv.Point(Math.floor(src.cols / 2), src.rows - 1),\n\t\tnew cv.Point(0, Math.floor(src.rows / 2)),\n\t\tnew cv.Point(src.cols - 1, Math.floor(src.rows / 2)),\n\t];\n\n\ttry {\n\t\tfor (const seedPoint of seedPoints) {\n\t\t\tif (seedPoint.x < 0 || seedPoint.x >= src.cols || seedPoint.y < 0 || seedPoint.y >= src.rows) continue;\n\n\t\t\tconst pixel = tempSrc.ucharPtr(seedPoint.y, seedPoint.x);\n\t\t\tconst r = pixel[0];\n\t\t\tconst g = pixel[1];\n\t\t\tconst b = pixel[2];\n\n\t\t\t// Check if this seed point matches any checker color\n\t\t\tlet matchesChecker = false;\n\t\t\tfor (const color of colors) {\n\t\t\t\tconst diff = Math.abs(r - color.r) + Math.abs(g - color.g) + Math.abs(b - color.b);\n\t\t\t\tif (diff < tolerance * 3) {\n\t\t\t\t\tmatchesChecker = true;\n\t\t\t\t\tbreak;\n\t\t\t\t}\n\t\t\t}\n\n\t\t\tif (matchesChecker) {\n\t\t\t\t// Flood fill from this point\n\t\t\t\tcv.floodFill(\n\t\t\t\t\ttempSrc,\n\t\t\t\t\tmask,\n\t\t\t\t\tseedPoint,\n\t\t\t\t\tnew cv.Scalar(255, 0, 255, 255), // Magenta marker\n\t\t\t\t\tnew cv.Rect(),\n\t\t\t\t\tnew cv.Scalar(tolerance, tolerance, tolerance, 0),\n\t\t\t\t\tnew cv.Scalar(tolerance, tolerance, tolerance, 0),\n\t\t\t\t\tcv.FLOODFILL_MASK_ONLY | (255 << 8)\n\t\t\t\t);\n\t\t\t}\n\t\t}\n\n\t\t// Apply the mask to alpha channel\n\t\tfor (let y = 0; y < src.rows; y++) {\n\t\t\tfor (let x = 0; x < src.cols; x++) {\n\t\t\t\tconst maskValue = mask.ucharPtr(y + 1, x + 1)[0];\n\t\t\t\tif (maskValue === 255) {\n\t\t\t\t\talpha.ucharPtr(y, x)[0] = 0;\n\t\t\t\t}\n\t\t\t}\n\t\t}\n\t} catch (e) {\n\t\tconsole.warn('Checkered pattern removal failed:', e);\n\t} finally {\n\t\tmask.delete();\n\t\ttempSrc.delete();\n\t}\n}",
  "new_string": "function removeCheckeredPattern(cv: any, src: any, alpha: any, tolerance: number): void {\n\t// Sample corner pixels to detect checkered pattern colors\n\tconst colors = sampleCheckerColors(src);\n\tif (colors.length === 0) return;\n\n\t// Create a visited mask to track which pixels we've already processed\n\tconst visited = new Array(src.rows).fill(0).map(() => new Array(src.cols).fill(false));\n\n\t// Seed points to start flood fill from (edges)\n\tconst seedPoints = [\n\t\t{ x: 0, y: 0 },\n\t\t{ x: src.cols - color.r) + Math.abs(seedG - color.g) + Math.abs(seedB - color.b);\n\t\t\tif (diff < tolerance * 3) {\n\t\t\t\tmatchesChecker = true;\n\t\t\t\tbreak;\n\t\t\t}\n\t\t}\n\n\t\tif (matchesChecker) {\n\t\t\t// Magic wand style flood fill\n\t\t\tmagicWandFill(src, alpha, visited, seedPoint.x, seedPoint.y, seedR, seedG, seedB, tolerance);\n\t\t}\n\t}\n}\n\nfunction magicWandFill(\n\tsrc: any,\n\talpha: any,\n\tvisited: boolean[][],\n\tstartX: number,\n\tstartY: number,\n\ttargetR: number,\n\ttargetG: number,\n\ttargetB: number,\n\ttolerance: number\n): void {\n\tconst stack = [{ x: startX, y: startY }];\n\tconst rows = src.rows;\n\tconst cols = src.cols;\n\n\twhile (stack.length > 0) {\n\t\tconst { x, y } = stack.pop()!;\n\n\t\t// Bounds check\n\t\tif (x < 0 || x >= cols || y < 0 || y >= rows) continue;\n\t\tif (visited[y][x]) continue;\n\n\t\tconst pixel = src.ucharPtr(y, x);\n\t\tconst r = pixel[0];\n\t\tconst g = pixel[1];\n\t\tconst b = pixel[2];\n\n\t\t// Color similarity check\n\t\tconst diff = Math.abs(r - targetR) + Math.abs(g - targetG) + Math.abs(b - targetB);\n\t\tif (diff > tolerance * 3) continue;\n\n\t\t// Mark as visited and transparent\n\t\tvisited[y][x] = true;\n\t\talpha.ucharPtr(y, x)[0] = 0;\n\n\t\t// Add neighbors to stack (4-connectivity)\n\t\tstack.push({ x: x + 1, y });\n\t\tstack.push({ x: x - 1, y });\n\t\tstack.push({ x, y: y + 1 });\n\t\tstack.push({ x, y: y - 1 });\n\t}\n}"

{
  "file_path": "/Users/jagzviruz/projects/personal/remove-bg/src/utils/imageProcessor.ts",
  "old_string": "function removeSolidBackground(cv: any, src: any, alpha...

        
        

            
{
  "file_path": "/Users/jagzviruz/projects/personal/remove-bg/src/utils/imageProcessor.ts",
  "old_string": "function removeSolidBackground(cv: any, src: any, alpha: any, tolerance: number): void {\n\t// Create mask for flood fill - must be (rows+2, cols+2) CV_8UC1\n\tconst mask = new cv.Mat(src.rows + 2, src.cols + 2, cv.CV_8UC1, new cv.Scalar(0));\n\tconst tempSrc = src.clone();\n\n\t// Flood fill from all corners and edge midpoints\n\tconst seedPoints = [\n\t\tnew cv.Point(0, 0),\n\t\tnew cv.Point(src.cols - 1, 0),\n\t\tnew cv.Point(0, src.rows - 1),\n\t\tnew cv.Point(src.cols - 1, src.rows - 1),\n\t\tnew cv.Point(Math.floor(src.cols / 2), 0),\n\t\tnew cv.Point(Math.floor(src.cols / 2), src.rows - 1),\n\t\tnew cv.Point(0, Math.floor(src.rows / 2)),\n\t\tnew cv.Point(src.cols - 1, Math.floor(src.rows / 2)),\n\t];\n\n\ttry {\n\t\tfor (const seedPoint of seedPoints) {\n\t\t\tif (seedPoint.x < 0 || seedPoint.x >= src.cols || seedPoint.y < 0 || seedPoint.y >= src.rows) continue;\n\n\t\t\t// Flood fill from this seed point\n\t\t\tcv.floodFill(\n\t\t\t\ttempSrc,\n\t\t\t\tmask,\n\t\t\t\tseedPoint,\n\t\t\t\tnew cv.Scalar(255, 0, 255, 255), // Magenta marker (won't be used, we only use mask)\n\t\t\t\tnew cv.Rect(),\n\t\t\t\tnew cv.Scalar(tolerance, tolerance, tolerance, 0),\n\t\t\t\tnew cv.Scalar(tolerance, tolerance, tolerance, 0),\n\t\t\t\tcv.FLOODFILL_MASK_ONLY | (255 << 8)\n\t\t\t);\n\t\t}\n\n\t\t// Apply the flood fill mask to alpha channel\n\t\t// Only pixels that were reached by flood fill from edges are made transparent\n\t\tfor (let y = 0; y < src.rows; y++) {\n\t\t\tfor (let x = 0; x < src.cols; x++) {\n\t\t\t\tconst maskValue = mask.ucharPtr(y + 1, x + 1)[0];\n\t\t\t\tif (maskValue === 255) {\n\t\t\t\t\talpha.ucharPtr(y, x)[0] = 0;\n\t\t\t\t}\n\t\t\t}\n\t\t}\n\t} catch (e) {\n\t\tconsole.warn('Solid background removal failed:', e);\n\t} finally {\n\t\tmask.delete();\n\t\ttempSrc.delete();\n\t}\n}",
  "new_string": "function removeSolidBackground(cv: any, src: any, alpha: any, tolerance: number): void {\n\t// Create a visited mask to track which pixels we've already processed\n\tconst visited = new Array(src.rows).fill(0).map(() => new Array(src.cols).fill(false));\n\n\t// Seed points to start flood fill from (edges)\n\tconst seedPoints = [\n\t\t{ x: 0, y: 0 },\n\t\t{ x: src.cols - 1, y: 0 },\n\t\t{ x: 0, y: src.rows - 1 },\n\t\t{ x: src.cols - 1, y: src.rows - 1 },\n\t\t{ x: Math.floor(src.cols / 2), y: 0 },\n\t\t{ x: Math.floor(src.cols / 2), src.rows - 1 },\n\t\t{ x: 0, y: Math.floor(src.rows / 2) },\n\t\t{ x: src.cols - 1, y: Math.floor(src.rows / 2) },\n\t];\n\n\t// Flood fill from each seed point using magic wand style algorithm\n\tfor (const seedPoint of seedPoints) {\n\t\tif (seedPoint.x < 0 || seedPoint.x >= src.cols || seedPoint.y < 0 || seedPoint.y >= src.rows) continue;\n\t\tif (visited[seedPoint.y][seedPoint.x]) continue;\n\n\t\tconst pixel = src.ucharPtr(seedPoint.y, seedPoint.x);\n\t\tconst r = pixel[0];\n\t\tconst g = pixel[1];\n\t\tconst b = pixel[2];\n\n\t\t// Magic wand style flood fill from this seed\n\t\tmagicWandFill(src, alpha, visited, seedPoint.x, seedPoint.y, r, g, b, tolerance);\n\t}\n}"
}

        

    

    

    

    
    
    
    

        

            üõ†Ô∏è Tool Use: Edit (Id: Toolu_01Jo2Dljc8Mgdkpe3Eeaqnaj)
            

                2025-10-07 13:04:44
                
            

        

        

    

        
            
{
  "file_path": "/Users/jagzviruz/projects/personal/remove-bg/src/utils/imageProcessor.ts",
  "old_string": "function removeSolidBackground(cv: any, src: any, alpha...

        
        

            
{
  "file_path": "/Users/jagzviruz/projects/personal/remove-bg/src/utils/imageProcessor.ts",
  "old_string": "function removeSolidBackground(cv: any, src: any, alpha: any, tolerance: number): void {\n\t// Create mask for flood fill - must be (rows+2, cols+2) CV_8UC1\n\tconst mask = new cv.Mat(src.rows + 2, src.cols + 2, cv.CV_8UC1, new cv.Scalar(0));\n\tconst tempSrc = src.clone();\n\n\t// Flood fill from all corners and edge midpoints\n\tconst seedPoints = [\n\t\tnew cv.Point(0, 0),\n\t\tnew cv.Point(src.cols - 1, 0),\n\t\tnew cv.Point(0, src.rows - 1),\n\t\tnew cv.Point(src.cols - 1, src.rows - 1),\n\t\tnew cv.Point(Math.floor(src.cols / 2), 0),\n\t\tnew cv.Point(Math.floor(src.cols / 2), src.rows - 1),\n\t\tnew cv.Point(0, Math.floor(src.rows / 2)),\n\t\tnew cv.Point(src.cols - 1, Math.floor(src.rows / 2)),\n\t];\n\n\ttry {\n\t\tfor (const seedPoint of seedPoints) {\n\t\t\tif (seedPoint.x < 0 || seedPoint.x >= src.cols || seedPoint.y < 0 || seedPoint.y >= src.rows) continue;\n\n\t\t\t// Flood fill from this seed point\n\t\t\tcv.floodFill(\n\t\t\t\ttempSrc,\n\t\t\t\tmask,\n\t\t\t\tseedPoint,\n\t\t\t\tnew cv.Scalar(255, 0, 255, 255), // Magenta marker (won't be used, we only use mask)\n\t\t\t\tnew cv.Rect(),\n\t\t\t\tnew cv.Scalar(tolerance, tolerance, tolerance, 0),\n\t\t\t\tnew cv.Scalar(tolerance, tolerance, tolerance, 0),\n\t\t\t\tcv.FLOODFILL_MASK_ONLY | (255 << 8)\n\t\t\t);\n\t\t}\n\n\t\t// Apply the flood fill mask to alpha channel\n\t\t// Only pixels that were reached by flood fill from edges are made transparent\n\t\tfor (let y = 0; y < src.rows; y++) {\n\t\t\tfor (let x = 0; x < src.cols; x++) {\n\t\t\t\tconst maskValue = mask.ucharPtr(y + 1, x + 1)[0];\n\t\t\t\tif (maskValue === 255) {\n\t\t\t\t\talpha.ucharPtr(y, x)[0] = 0;\n\t\t\t\t}\n\t\t\t}\n\t\t}\n\t} catch (e) {\n\t\tconsole.warn('Solid background removal failed:', e);\n\t} finally {\n\t\tmask.delete();\n\t\ttempSrc.delete();\n\t}\n}",
  "new_string": "function removeSolidBackground(cv: any, src: any, alpha: any, tolerance: number): void {\n\t// Create a visited mask to track which pixels we've already processed\n\tconst visited = new Array(src.rows).fill(0).map(() => new Array(src.cols).fill(false));\n\n\t// Seed points to start flood fill from (edges)\n\tconst seedPoints = [\n\t\t{ x: 0, y: 0 },\n\t\t{ x: src.cols - 1, y: 0 },\n\t\t{ x: 0, y: src.rows - 1 },\n\t\t{ x: src.cols - 1, y: src.rows - 1 },\n\t\t{ x: Math.floor(src.cols / 2), y: 0 },\n\t\t{ x: Math.floor(src.cols / 2), src.rows - 1 },\n\t\t{ x: 0, y: Math.floor(src.rows / 2) },\n\t\t{ x: src.cols - 1, y: Math.floor(src.rows / 2) },\n\t];\n\n\t// Flood fill from each seed point using magic wand style algorithm\n\tfor (const seedPoint of seedPoints) {\n\t\tif (seedPoint.x < 0 || seedPoint.x >= src.cols || seedPoint.y < 0 || seedPoint.y >= src.rows) continue;\n\t\tif (visited[seedPoint.y][seedPoint.x]) continue;\n\n\t\tconst pixel = src.ucharPtr(seedPoint.y, seedPoint.x);\n\t\tconst r = pixel[0];\n\t\tconst g = pixel[1];\n\t\tconst b = pixel[2];\n\n\t\t// Magic wand style flood fill from this seed\n\t\tmagicWandFill(src, alpha, visited, seedPoint.x, seedPoint.y, r, g, b, tolerance);\n\t}\n}"
}

The file /Users/jagzviruz/projects/personal/remove-bg/src/utils/imageProcessor.ts has been updated. Here's the result of running `cat -n` on a snippet of the edited file:
    60‚Üí		dst.delete();
    61‚Üí	}
    62‚Üí};
    63‚Üí
    64‚Üífunction removeCheckeredPattern(cv: any, src: any, alpha: any, tolerance: number): void {
    65‚Üí	// Sample corner pixels to detect checkered pattern colors
    66‚Üí	const colors = sampleCheckerColors(src);
    67‚Üí	if (colors.length === 0) return;
    68‚Üí
    69‚Üí	// Create a visited mask to track which pixels we've already processed
    70‚Üí	const visited = new Array(src.rows).fill(0).map(() => new Array(src.cols).fill(false));
    71‚Üí
    72‚Üí	// Seed points to start flood fill from (edges)
    73‚Üí	const seedPoints = [
    74‚Üí		{ x: 0, y: 0 },
    75‚Üí		{ x: src.cols - 1, y: 0 },
    76‚Üí		{ x: 0, y: src.rows - 1 },
    77‚Üí		{ x: src.cols - 1, y: src.rows - 1 },
    78‚Üí		{ x: Math.floor(src.cols / 2), y: 0 },
    79‚Üí		{ x: Math.floor(src.cols / 2), y: src.rows - 1 },
    80‚Üí		{ x: 0, y: Math.floor(src.rows / 2) },
    81‚Üí		{ x: src.cols - 1, y: Math.floor(src.rows / 2) },
    82‚Üí	];
    83‚Üí
    84‚Üí	// Flood fill from each seed point
    85‚Üí	for (const seedPoint of seedPoints) {
    86‚Üí		if (seedPoint.x < 0 || seedPoint.x >= src.cols || seedPoint.y < 0 || seedPoint.y >= src.rows) continue;
    87‚Üí		if (visited[seedPoint.y][seedPoint.x]) continue;
    88‚Üí
    89‚Üí		const pixel = src.ucharPtr(seedPoint.y, seedPoint.x);
    90‚Üí		const seedR = pixel[0];
    91‚Üí		const seedG = pixel[1];
    92‚Üí		const seedB = pixel[2];
    93‚Üí
    94‚Üí		// Check if seed matches any checker color
    95‚Üí		let matchesChecker = false;
    96‚Üí		for (const color of colors) {
    97‚Üí			const diff = Math.abs(seedR - color.r) + Math.abs(seedG - color.g) + Math.abs(seedB - color.b);
    98‚Üí			if (diff < tolerance * 3) {
    99‚Üí				matchesChecker = true;
   100‚Üí				break;
   101‚Üí			}
   102‚Üí		}
   103‚Üí
   104‚Üí		if (matchesChecker) {
   105‚Üí			// Magic wand style flood fill
   106‚Üí			magicWandFill(src, alpha, visited, seedPoint.x, seedPoint.y, seedR, seedG, seedB, tolerance);
   107‚Üí		}
   108‚Üí	}
   109‚Üí}
   110‚Üí
   111‚Üífunction magicWandFill(
   112‚Üí	src: any,
   113‚Üí	alpha: any,
   114‚Üí	visited: boolean[][],
   115‚Üí	startX: number,
   116‚Üí	startY: number,
   117‚Üí	targetR: number,
   118‚Üí	targetG: number,
   119‚Üí	targetB: number,
   120‚Üí	tolerance: number
   121‚Üí): void {
   122‚Üí	const stack = [{ x: startX, y: startY }];
   123‚Üí	const rows = src.rows;
   124‚Üí	const cols = src.cols;
   125‚Üí
   126‚Üí	while (stack.length > 0) {
   127‚Üí		const { x, y } = stack.pop()!;
   128‚Üí
   129‚Üí		// Bounds check
   130‚Üí		if (x < 0 || x >= cols || y < 0 || y >= rows) continue;
   131‚Üí		if (visited[y][x]) continue;
   132‚Üí
   133‚Üí		const pixel = src.ucharPtr(y, x);
   134‚Üí		const r = pixel[0];
   135‚Üí		const g = pixel[1];
   136‚Üí		const b = pixel[2];
   137‚Üí
   138‚Üí		// Color similarity check
   139‚Üí		const diff = Math.abs(r - targetR) + Math.abs(g - targetG) + Math.abs(b - targetB);
   140‚Üí		if (diff > tolerance * 3) continue;
   141‚Üí
   142‚Üí		// Mark as visited and transparent
   143‚Üí		visited[y][x] = true;
   144‚Üí		alpha.ucharPtr(y, x)[0] = 0;
   145‚Üí
   146‚Üí		// Add neighbors to stack (4-connectivity)
   147‚Üí		stack.push({ x: x + 1, y });
   148‚Üí		stack.push({ x: x - 1, y });
   149‚Üí		stack.push({ x, y: y + 1 });
   150‚Üí		stack.push({ x, y: y - 1 });
   151‚Üí	}
   152‚Üí}
   153‚Üí
   154‚Üífunction sampleCheckerColors(src: any): Array<{ r: number; g: number; b: number }> {
   155‚Üí	// Sample pixels from corners and edges to detect pattern
   156‚Üí	const samples: Array<{ r: number; g: number; b: number }> = [];

    64‚Üífunction removeCheckeredPattern(cv: any, src: any, alpha: any, tolerance: number): void {
    65‚Üí	// Sample corner pixels to detect checkered pattern colors
    66‚Üí	const colors = sampleCheckerColors(src);
    67‚Üí	if (colors.length === 0) return;
    68‚Üí
    69‚Üí	// Create a visited mask to track which pixels we've already processed
    70‚Üí	const visited = new Array(src.rows).fill(0).map(() => new Array(src.cols).fill(false));
    71‚Üí
    72‚Üí	// Seed points to start flood fill from (edges)
    73‚Üí	const seedPoints = [
    74‚Üí		{ x: 0, y: 0 },
    75‚Üí		{ x: src.cols - 1, y: 0 },
    76‚Üí		{ x: 0, y: src.rows - 1 },
    77‚Üí		{ x: src.cols - 1, y: src.rows - 1 },
    78‚Üí		{ x: Math.floor(src.cols / 2), y: 0 },
    79‚Üí		{ x: Math.floor(src.cols / 2), y: src.rows - 1 },
    80‚Üí		{ x: 0, y: Math.floor(src.rows / 2) },
    81‚Üí		{ x: src.cols - 1, y: Math.floor(src.rows / 2) },
    82‚Üí	];
    83‚Üí
    84‚Üí	// Flood fill from each seed point
    85‚Üí	for (const seedPoint of seedPoints) {
    86‚Üí		if (seedPoint.x < 0 || seedPoint.x >= src.cols || seedPoint.y < 0 || seedPoint.y >= src.rows) continue;
    87‚Üí		if (visited[seedPoint.y][seedPoint.x]) continue;
    88‚Üí
    89‚Üí		const pixel = src.ucharPtr(seedPoint.y, seedPoint.x);
    90‚Üí		const seedR = pixel[0];
    91‚Üí		const seedG = pixel[1];
    92‚Üí		const seedB = pixel[2];
    93‚Üí
    94‚Üí		// Check if seed matches any checker color
    95‚Üí		let matchesChecker = false;
    96‚Üí		for (const color of colors) {
    97‚Üí			const diff = Math.abs(seedR - color.r) + Math.abs(seedG - color.g) + Math.abs(seedB - color.b);
    98‚Üí			if (diff < tolerance * 3) {
    99‚Üí				matchesChecker = true;
   100‚Üí				break;
   101‚Üí			}
   102‚Üí		}
   103‚Üí
   104‚Üí		if (matchesChecker) {
   105‚Üí			// Magic wand style flood fill
   106‚Üí			magicWandFill(src, alpha, visited, seedPoint.x, seedPoint.y, seedR, seedG, seedB, tolerance);
   107‚Üí		}
   108‚Üí	}
   109‚Üí}
   110‚Üí
   111‚Üífunction magicWandFill(
   112‚Üí	src: any,
   113‚Üí	alpha: any,
   114‚Üí	visited: boolean[][],
   115‚Üí	startX: number,
   116‚Üí	startY: number,
   117‚Üí	targetR: number,
   118‚Üí	targetG: number,
   119‚Üí	targetB: number,
   120‚Üí	tolerance: number
   121‚Üí): void {
   122‚Üí	const stack = [{ x: startX, y: startY }];
   123‚Üí	const rows = src.rows;
   124‚Üí	const cols = src.cols;
   125‚Üí
   126‚Üí	while (stack.length > 0) {
   127‚Üí		const { x, y } = stack.pop()!;
   128‚Üí
   129‚Üí		// Bounds check
   130‚Üí		if (x < 0 || x >= cols || y < 0 || y >= rows) continue;
   131‚Üí		if (visited[y][x]) continue;
   132‚Üí
   133‚Üí		const pixel = src.ucharPtr(y, x);
   134‚Üí		const r = pixel[0];
   135‚Üí		const g = pixel[1];
   136‚Üí		const b = pixel[2];
   137‚Üí
   138‚Üí		// Color similarity check
   139‚Üí		const diff = Math.abs(r - targetR) + Math.abs(g - targetG) + Math.abs(b - targetB);
   140‚Üí		if (diff > tolerance * 3) continue;
   141‚Üí
   142‚Üí		// Mark as visited and transparent
   143‚Üí		visited[y][x] = true;
   144‚Üí		alpha.ucharPtr(y, x)[0] = 0;
   145‚Üí
   146‚Üí		// Add neighbors to stack (4-connectivity)
   147‚Üí		stack.push({ x: x + 1, y });
   148‚Üí		stack.push({ x: x - 1, y });
   149‚Üí		stack.push({ x, y: y + 1 });
   150‚Üí		stack.push({ x, y: y - 1 });
   151‚Üí	}
   152‚Üí}
   153‚Üí

   155‚Üí	// Sample pixels from corners and edges to detect pattern
   156‚Üí	const samples: Array<{ r: number; g: number; b: number }> = [];

   206‚Üífunction removeSolidBackground(cv: any, src: any, alpha: any, tolerance: number): void {
   207‚Üí	// Create a visited mask to track which pixels we've already processed
   208‚Üí	const visited = new Array(src.rows).fill(0).map(() => new Array(src.cols).fill(false));
   209‚Üí
   210‚Üí	// Seed points to start flood fill from (edges)
   211‚Üí	const seedPoints = [
   212‚Üí		{ x: 0, y: 0 },
   213‚Üí		{ x: src.cols - 1, y: 0 },
   214‚Üí		{ x: 0, y: src.rows - 1 },
   215‚Üí		{ x: src.cols - 1, y: src.rows - 1 },
   216‚Üí		{ x: Math.floor(src.cols / 2), y: 0 },
   217‚Üí		{ x: Math.floor(src.cols / 2), src.rows - 1 },
   218‚Üí		{ x: 0, y: Math.floor(src.rows / 2) },
   219‚Üí		{ x: src.cols - 1, y: Math.floor(src.rows / 2) },
   220‚Üí	];
   221‚Üí
   222‚Üí	// Flood fill from each seed point using magic wand style algorithm
   223‚Üí	for (const seedPoint of seedPoints) {
   224‚Üí		if (seedPoint.x < 0 || seedPoint.x >= src.cols || seedPoint.y < 0 || seedPoint.y >= src.rows) continue;
   225‚Üí		if (visited[seedPoint.y][seedPoint.x]) continue;
   226‚Üí
   227‚Üí		const pixel = src.ucharPtr(seedPoint.y, seedPoint.x);
   228‚Üí		const r = pixel[0];
   229‚Üí		const g = pixel[1];
   230‚Üí		const b = pixel[2];
   231‚Üí
   232‚Üí		// Magic wand style flood fill from this seed
   233‚Üí		magicWandFill(src, alpha, visited, seedPoint.x, seedPoint.y, r, g, b, tolerance);
   234‚Üí	}
   235‚Üí}
   236‚Üí
   237‚Üífunction removeShadows(cv: any, src: any, alpha: any, tolerance: number): void {
   238‚Üí	// Convert to HSV to better detect shadows
   239‚Üí	const hsv = new cv.Mat();

   206‚Üífunction removeSolidBackground(cv: any, src: any, alpha: any, tolerance: number): void {
   207‚Üí	// Create a visited mask to track which pixels we've already processed
   208‚Üí	const visited = new Array(src.rows).fill(0).map(() => new Array(src.cols).fill(false));
   209‚Üí
   210‚Üí	// Seed points to start flood fill from (edges)
   211‚Üí	const seedPoints = [
   212‚Üí		{ x: 0, y: 0 },
   213‚Üí		{ x: src.cols - 1, y: 0 },
   214‚Üí		{ x: 0, y: src.rows - 1 },
   215‚Üí		{ x: src.cols - 1, y: src.rows - 1 },
   216‚Üí		{ x: Math.floor(src.cols / 2), y: 0 },
   217‚Üí		{ x: Math.floor(src.cols / 2), src.rows - 1 },
   218‚Üí		{ x: 0, y: Math.floor(src.rows / 2) },
   219‚Üí		{ x: src.cols - 1, y: Math.floor(src.rows / 2) },
   220‚Üí	];
   221‚Üí
   222‚Üí	// Flood fill from each seed point using magic wand style algorithm
   223‚Üí	for (const seedPoint of seedPoints) {
   224‚Üí		if (seedPoint.x < 0 || seedPoint.x >= src.cols || seedPoint.y < 0 || seedPoint.y >= src.rows) continue;
   225‚Üí		if (visited[seedPoint.y][seedPoint.x]) continue;
   226‚Üí
   227‚Üí		const pixel = src.ucharPtr(seedPoint.y, seedPoint.x);
   228‚Üí		const r = pixel[0];
   229‚Üí		const g = pixel[1];
   230‚Üí		const b = pixel[2];
   231‚Üí
   232‚Üí		// Magic wand style flood fill from this seed
   233‚Üí		magicWandFill(src, alpha, visited, seedPoint.x, seedPoint.y, r, g, b, tolerance);
   234‚Üí	}
   235‚Üí}
   236‚Üí
   237‚Üífunction removeShadows(cv: any, src: any, alpha: any, tolerance: number): void {
   238‚Üí	// Convert to HSV to better detect shadows
   239‚Üí	const hsv = new cv.Mat();

                2025-10-07 13:04:49

I need to fix the typo in the seedPoints array where I have `src.rows - 1` instead of `y: src.rows - 1`.

{
  "file_path": "/Users/jagzviruz/projects/personal/remove-bg/src/utils/imageProcessor.ts",
  "old_string": "\t// Seed points to start flood fill from (edges)\n\tconst seedPoints = [\n\t\t{ x: 0, y: 0 },\n\t\t{ x: src.cols - 1, y: 0 },\n\t\t{ x: 0, y: src.rows - 1 },\n\t\t{ x: src.cols - 1, y: src.rows - 1 },\n\t\t{ x: Math.floor(src.cols / 2), y: 0 },\n\t\t{ x: Math.floor(src.cols / 2), src.rows - 1 },\n\t\t{ x: 0, y: Math.floor(src.rows / 2) },\n\t\t{ x: src.cols - 1, y: Math.floor(src.rows / 2) },\n\t];",

   209‚Üí

   206‚Üífunction removeSolidBackground(cv: any, src: any, alpha: any, tolerance: number): void {
   207‚Üí	// Create a visited mask to track which pixels we've already processed
   208‚Üí	const visited = new Array(src.rows).fill(0).map(() => new Array(src.cols).fill(false));
   209‚Üí
   210‚Üí	// Seed points to start flood fill from (edges)
   211‚Üí	const seedPoints = [
   212‚Üí		{ x: 0, y: 0 },
   213‚Üí		{ x: src.cols - 1, y: 0 },
   214‚Üí		{ x: 0, y: src.rows - 1 },

   216‚Üí		{ x: Math.floor(src.cols / 2), y: 0 },
   217‚Üí		{ x: Math.floor(src.cols / 2), y: src.rows - 1 },
   218‚Üí		{ x: 0, y: Math.floor(src.rows / 2) },
   219‚Üí		{ x: src.cols - 1, y: Math.floor(src.rows / 2) },
   220‚Üí	];
   221‚Üí
   222‚Üí	// Flood fill from each seed point using magic wand style algorithm
   223‚Üí	for (const seedPoint of seedPoints) {
   224‚Üí		if (seedPoint.x < 0 || seedPoint.x >= src.cols || seedPoint.y < 0 || seedPoint.y >= src.rows) continue;
   225‚Üí		if (visited[seedPoint.y][seedPoint.x]) continue;
   226‚Üí
   227‚Üí		const pixel = src.ucharPtr(seedPoint.y, seedPoint.x);
   228‚Üí		const r = pixel[0];
   229‚Üí		const g = pixel[1];
   230‚Üí		const b = pixel[2];

   206‚Üífunction removeSolidBackground(cv: any, src: any, alpha: any, tolerance: number): void {
   207‚Üí	// Create a visited mask to track which pixels we've already processed
   208‚Üí	const visited = new Array(src.rows).fill(0).map(() => new Array(src.cols).fill(false));
   209‚Üí
   210‚Üí	// Seed points to start flood fill from (edges)
   211‚Üí	const seedPoints = [
   212‚Üí		{ x: 0, y: 0 },
   213‚Üí		{ x: src.cols - 1, y: 0 },
   214‚Üí		{ x: 0, y: src.rows - 1 },
   215‚Üí		{ x: src.cols - 1, y: src.rows - 1 },
   216‚Üí		{ x: Math.floor(src.cols / 2), y: 0 },
   217‚Üí		{ x: Math.floor(src.cols / 2), y: src.rows - 1 },
   218‚Üí		{ x: 0, y: Math.floor(src.rows / 2) },
   219‚Üí		{ x: src.cols - 1, y: Math.floor(src.rows / 2) },
   220‚Üí	];
   221‚Üí
   222‚Üí	// Flood fill from each seed point using magic wand style algorithm
   223‚Üí	for (const seedPoint of seedPoints) {
   224‚Üí		if (seedPoint.x < 0 || seedPoint.x >= src.cols || seedPoint.y < 0 || seedPoint.y >= src.rows) continue;
   225‚Üí		if (visited[seedPoint.y][seedPoint.x]) continue;
   226‚Üí
   227‚Üí		const pixel = src.ucharPtr(seedPoint.y, seedPoint.x);
   228‚Üí		const r = pixel[0];
   229‚Üí		const g = pixel[1];
   230‚Üí		const b = pixel[2];

            üí≠ Thinking
            

                2025-10-07 13:05:29
                
            

        

        
Great! The server started successfully. Now let me document what I've done.

    

    
    
    
    

        

            ü§ñ Assistant
            

                2025-10-07 13:05:37
                
            

        

        
Perfect! I've implemented a magic wand style flood fill algorithm that works like Photoshop's magic wand tool. Here's what changed:


Magic Wand Implementation


How It Works:


    

  1. Seed Points: Starts from 8 points along the edges (4 corners + 4 edge midpoints)
    

    2. 

  2. Stack-Based Flood Fill: Uses an iterative algorithm with a stack instead of OpenCV's built-in flood fill
    

      

    • Pops pixel from stack
      • 

    • Checks if color is similar to target (within tolerance)
      • 

    • Marks as visited and transparent
      • 

    • Pushes 4 neighbors (up, down, left, right) onto stack
      • 

    

    3. 

  3. Continuous Region Detection: Only removes pixels that are:
    

      

    • Connected to an edge seed point
      • 

    • Within the color tolerance range
      • 

    • Part of a continuous region
      • 

    

    4. 



Key Benefits:


‚úÖ Preserves foreground objects - White clothes won't be removed when removing white background

‚úÖ Simple and reliable - No complex OpenCV flags or mask indexing

‚úÖ Fast - Stack-based iteration is efficient

‚úÖ Works like Photoshop - Same algorithm as the magic wand tool


Both Functions Updated:


    

  • removeCheckeredPattern() - Removes continuous checkered regions from edges
    • 

  • removeSolidBackground() - Removes continuous solid color regions from edges
    • 



The dev server is running at http://localhost:5173/ - test it with images that have foreground objects matching the background color!



    

    
    
    
    

        

            ü§ñ Assistant
            

                2025-10-07 13:05:37
                
            

        

        
Perfect! I've implemented a magic wand style flood fill algorithm that works like Photoshop's magic wand tool. Here's what changed:


Magic Wand Implementation


How It Works:


    

  1. Seed Points: Starts from 8 points along the edges (4 corners + 4 edge midpoints)
    

    2. 

  2. Stack-Based Flood Fill: Uses an iterative algorithm with a stack instead of OpenCV's built-in flood fill
    

      

    • Pops pixel from stack
      • 

    • Checks if color is similar to target (within tolerance)
      • 

    • Marks as visited and transparent
      • 

    • Pushes 4 neighbors (up, down, left, right) onto stack
      • 

    

    3. 

  3. Continuous Region Detection: Only removes pixels that are:
    

      

    • Connected to an edge seed point
      • 

    • Within the color tolerance range
      • 

    • Part of a continuous region
      • 

    

    4. 



Key Benefits:


‚úÖ Preserves foreground objects - White clothes won't be removed when removing white background

‚úÖ Simple and reliable - No complex OpenCV flags or mask indexing

‚úÖ Fast - Stack-based iteration is efficient

‚úÖ Works like Photoshop - Same algorithm as the magic wand tool


Both Functions Updated:


    

  • removeCheckeredPattern() - Removes continuous checkered regions from edges
    • 

  • removeSolidBackground() - Removes continuous solid color regions from edges
    • 



The dev server is running at http://localhost:5173/ - test it with images that have foreground objects matching the background color!

   226‚Üí				</main>

Perfect! I've updated the entire UI to a much brighter theme. Here's what changed:


Brightness Updates:


Main Background


    

  • Before: Dark slate-900 ‚Üí blue-900 ‚Üí indigo-900
    • 

  • After: Light blue-50 ‚Üí indigo-100 ‚Üí purple-100
    • 



Typography & Text


    

  • Headers: Changed from light blue/white to dark blue-600/indigo-600 gradients
    • 

  • Body text: Changed from blue-100/200 to gray-700/800
    • 

  • Descriptions: Changed from blue-200/80 to gray-600
    • 



Cards & Panels


    

  • Before: Semi-transparent dark (white/5, white/10)
    • 

  • After: Light white backgrounds (white/80, white/90) with proper shadows
    • 



Buttons & Controls


    

  • Upload area: Now white/80 background with gray-300 borders, hovers to blue-50
    • 

  • Process button: Kept gradient glow but brighter blue/indigo/purple colors
    • 

  • Download button: Changed from green to blue/indigo/purple gradient
    • 

  • Checkboxes: Gray-300 borders instead of white/20
    • 



Modal


    

  • Background: White instead of dark gradient
    • 

  • Text: Gray-700/800 instead of white/blue
    • 

  • Borders: Gray-200/300 instead of white/10
    • 



Icons & Accents


    

  • Icons: Blue-500/600 instead of blue-300
    • 

  • Bullets: Blue-600 instead of blue-400
    • 

  • Borders: Gray-200/300 instead of white/10
    • 



The dev server has hot-reloaded all changes at http://localhost:5173/ - the UI should now be much brighter and more readable!

implement a feature to show which areas would be removed with the current settings of the control. it can either be a red mask overlay or marching ants simalr to image editing programs. be mindful of performance.

    

    
    
    
    

        

            ü§∑ User
            

                2025-10-07 13:18:57
                
            

        

        
implement a feature to show which areas would be removed with the current settings of the control. it can either be a red mask overlay or marching ants simalr to image editing programs. be mindful of performance.

    

    
    
    
    

        

            üí≠ Thinking
            

                2025-10-07 13:19:13
                
            

        

        

    

        
            
The user wants to add a preview feature that shows which areas will be removed before the actual processing happens. This is like Photoshop's selection preview. I have a few options:

1. Red mask...

        
        

            
The user wants to add a preview feature that shows which areas will be removed before the actual processing happens. This is like Photoshop's selection preview. I have a few options:

1. Red mask overlay - simpler to implement, show transparent areas in red
2. Marching ants - animated dashed border around selected regions

For performance, I need to:
- Not run the full processing on every settings change
- Use a debounced/throttled approach
- Maybe use a lower resolution preview
- Use requestAnimationFrame for marching ants if I go that route

I think the best approach is:
1. Add a "Preview" button or toggle to enable preview mode
2. When enabled, run the same magic wand logic but instead of making pixels transparent, mark them in a mask
3. Display the mask as a red overlay over the original image
4. Update the preview when tolerance changes (with debouncing)

Let me implement this step by step:
1. Add preview state and button to ProcessingControls
2. Create a preview function in imageProcessor that returns a mask instead of transparent image
3. Display the mask overlay on the image preview
4. Add debouncing for tolerance changes

Actually, for performance, I should make it a toggle button that when clicked, generates the preview once. Then if they change settings, they need to click preview again.

        

    

    

    

    
    
    
    

        

            üí≠ Thinking
            

                2025-10-07 13:19:13
                
            

        

        

    

        
            
The user wants to add a preview feature that shows which areas will be removed before the actual processing happens. This is like Photoshop's selection preview. I have a few options:

1. Red mask...

        
        

            
The user wants to add a preview feature that shows which areas will be removed before the actual processing happens. This is like Photoshop's selection preview. I have a few options:

1. Red mask overlay - simpler to implement, show transparent areas in red
2. Marching ants - animated dashed border around selected regions

For performance, I need to:
- Not run the full processing on every settings change
- Use a debounced/throttled approach
- Maybe use a lower resolution preview
- Use requestAnimationFrame for marching ants if I go that route

I think the best approach is:
1. Add a "Preview" button or toggle to enable preview mode
2. When enabled, run the same magic wand logic but instead of making pixels transparent, mark them in a mask
3. Display the mask as a red overlay over the original image
4. Update the preview when tolerance changes (with debouncing)

Let me implement this step by step:
1. Add preview state and button to ProcessingControls
2. Create a preview function in imageProcessor that returns a mask instead of transparent image
3. Display the mask overlay on the image preview
4. Add debouncing for tolerance changes

Actually, for performance, I should make it a toggle button that when clicked, generates the preview once. Then if they change settings, they need to click preview again.

{
  "file_path": "/Users/jagzviruz/projects/personal/remove-bg/src/utils/imageProcessor.ts",
  "old_string": "export interface ProcessingOptions {\n\tremoveCheckered: boolean;\n\tremoveSolid: boolean;\n\tremoveShadow: boolean;\n\ttolerance: number;\n}\n\nexport const processImage = (cv: any, imageElement: HTMLImageElement, options: ProcessingOptions): string => {",
  "new_string": "export interface ProcessingOptions {\n\tremoveCheckered: boolean;\n\tremoveSolid: boolean;\n\tremoveShadow: boolean;\n\ttolerance: number;\n}\n\nexport const generatePreviewMask = (cv: any, imageElement: HTMLImageElement, options: ProcessingOptions): string => {\n\tif (!cv) {\n\t\tthrow new Error('OpenCV is not loaded yet. Please wait a moment and try again.');\n\t}\n\n\tconst src = cv.imread(imageElement);\n\ttry {\n\t\t// Convert to RGBA if not already\n\t\tif (src.channels() === 3) {\n\t\t\tcv.cvtColor(src, src, cv.COLOR_RGB2RGBA);\n\t\t}\n\n\t\t// Create mask to track what will be removed\n\t\tconst mask = new cv.Mat(src.rows, src.cols, cv.CV_8UC1, new cv.Scalar(0));\n\n\t\t// Apply same logic as processing but just create mask\n\t\tif (options.removeCheckered) {\n\t\t\tconst colors = sampleCheckerColors(src);\n\t\t\tif (colors.length > 0) {\n\t\t\t\tconst visited = new Array(src.rows).fill(0).map(() => new Array(src.cols).fill(false));\n\t\t\t\tconst seedPoints = [\n\t\t\t\t\t{ x: 0, y: 0 },\n\t\t\t\t\t{ x: src.cols - 1, y: 0 },\n\t\t\t\t\t{ x: 0, y: src.rows - 1 },\n\t\t\t\t\t{ x: src.cols - 1, y: src.rows - 1 },\n\t\t\t\t\t{ x: Math.floor(src.cols / 2), y: 0 },\n\t\t\t\t\t{ x: Math.floor(src.cols / 2), y: src.rows - 1 },\n\t\t\t\t\t{ x: 0, y: Math.floor(src.rows / 2) },\n\t\t\t\t\t{ x: src.cols - 1, y: Math.floor(src.rows / 2) },\n\t\t\t\t];\n\n\t\t\t\tfor (const seedPoint of seedPoints) {\n\t\t\t\t\tif (seedPoint.x < 0 || seedPoint.x >= src.cols || seedPoint.y < 0 || seedPoint.y >= src.rows) continue;\n\t\t\t\t\tif (visited[seedPoint.y][seedPoint.x]) continue;\n\n\t\t\t\t\tconst pixel = src.ucharPtr(seedPoint.y, seedPoint.x);\n\t\t\t\t\tconst seedR = pixel[0];\n\t\t\t\t\tconst seedG = pixel[1];\n\t\t\t\t\tconst seedB = pixel[2];\n\n\t\t\t\t\tlet matchesChecker = false;\n\t\t\t\t\tfor (const color of colors) {\n\t\t\t\t\t\tconst diff = Math.abs(seedR - color.r) + Math.abs(seedG - color.g) + Math.abs(seedB - color.b);\n\t\t\t\t\t\tif (diff < options.tolerance * 3) {\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\tmatchesChecker = true;\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\tbreak;\n\t\t\t\t\t\t}\n\t\t\t\t\t}\n\n\t\t\t\t\tif (matchesChecker) {\n\t\t\t\t\t\tmagicWandFillMask(src, mask, visited, seedPoint.x, seedPoint.y, seedR, seedG, seedB, options.tolerance);\n\t\t\t\t\t}\n\t\t\t\t}\n\t\t\t}\n\t\t}\n\n\t\tif (options.removeSolid) {\n\t\t\tconst visited = new Array(src.rows).fill(0).map(() => new Array(src.cols).fill(false));\n\t\t\tconst seedPoints = [\n\t\t\t\t{ x: 0, y: 0 },\n\t\t\t\t{ x: src.cols - 1, y: 0 },\n\t\t\t\t{ x: 0, y: src.rows - 1 },\n\t\t\t\t{ x: src.cols - 1, y: src.rows - 1 },\n\t\t\t\t{ x: Math.floor(src.cols / 2), y: 0 },\n\t\t\t\t{ x: Math.floor(src.cols / 2), y: src.rows - 1 },\n\t\t\t\t{ x: 0, y: Math.floor(src.rows / 2) },\n\t\t\t\t{ x: src.cols - 1, y: Math.floor(src.rows / 2) },\n\t\t\t];\n\n\t\t\tfor (const seedPoint of seedPoints) {\n\t\t\t\tif (seedPoint.x < 0 || seedPoint.x >= src.cols || seedPoint.y < 0 || seedPoint.y >= src.rows) continue;\n\t\t\t\tif (visited[seedPoint.y][seedPoint.x]) continue;\n\n\t\t\t\tconst pixel = src.ucharPtr(seedPoint.y, seedPoint.x);\n\t\t\t\tconst r = pixel[0];\n\t\t\t\tconst g = pixel[1];\n\t\t\t\tconst b = pixel[2];\n\n\t\t\t\tmagicWandFillMask(src, mask, visited, seedPoint.x, seedPoint.y, r, g, b, options.tolerance);\n\t\t\t}\n\t\t}\n\n\t\t// Create red overlay for masked areas\n\t\tconst overlay = new cv.Mat(src.rows, src.cols, cv.CV_8UC4);\n\t\tfor (let y = 0; y < src.rows; y++) {\n\t\t\tfor (let x = 0; x < src.cols; x++) {\n\t\t\t\tconst srcPixel = src.ucharPtr(y, x);\n\t\t\t\tconst overlayPixel = overlay.ucharPtr(y, x);\n\t\t\t\tconst maskValue = mask.ucharPtr(y, x)[0];\n\n\t\t\t\tif (maskValue === 255) {\n\t\t\t\t\t// Red overlay with 50% opacity\n\t\t\t\t\toverlayPixel[0] = Math.floor(srcPixel[0] * 0.5 + 255 * 0.5);\n\t\t\t\t\toverlayPixel[1] = Math.floor(srcPixel[1] * 0.5);\n\t\t\t\t\toverlayPixel[2] = Math.floor(srcPixel[2] * 0.5);\n\t\t\t\t\toverlayPixel[3] = 255;\n\t\t\t\t} else {\n\t\t\t\t\toverlayPixel[0] = srcPixel[0];\n\t\t\t\t\toverlayPixel[1] = srcPixel[1];\n\t\t\t\t\toverlayPixel[2] = srcPixel[2];\n\t\t\t\t\toverlayPixel[3] = srcPixel[3] || 255;\n\t\t\t\t}\n\t\t\t}\n\t\t}\n\n\t\tconst canvas = document.createElement('canvas');\n\t\tcanvas.width = imageElement.naturalWidth || src.cols;\n\t\tcanvas.height = imageElement.naturalHeight || src.rows;\n\t\tcv.imshow(canvas, overlay);\n\t\tconst dataUrl = canvas.toDataURL('image/png');\n\n\t\tmask.delete();\n\t\toverlay.delete();\n\t\treturn dataUrl;\n\t} finally {\n\t\tsrc.delete();\n\t}\n};\n\nfunction magicWandFillMask(\n\tsrc: any,\n\tmask: any,\n\tvisited: boolean[][],\n\tstartX: number,\n\tstartY: number,\n\ttargetR: number,\n\ttargetG: number,\n\ttargetB: number,\n\ttolerance: number\n): void {\n\tconst stack = [{ x: startX, y: startY }];\n\tconst rows = src.rows;\n\tconst cols = src.cols;\n\n\twhile (stack.length > 0) {\n\t\tconst { x, y } = stack.pop()!;\n\n\t\tif (x < 0 || x >= cols || y < 0 || y >= rows) continue;\n\t\tif (visited[y][x]) continue;\n\n\t\tconst pixel = src.ucharPtr(y, x);\n\t\tconst r = pixel[0];\n\t\tconst g = pixel[1];\n\t\tconst b = pixel[2];\n\n\t\tconst diff = Math.abs(r - targetR) + Math.abs(g - targetG) + Math.abs(b - targetB);\n\t\tif (diff > tolerance * 3) continue;\n\n\t\tvisited[y][x] = true;\n\t\tmask.ucharPtr(y, x)[0] = 255;\n\n\t\tstack.push({ x: x + 1, y });\n\t\tstack.push({ x: x - 1, y });\n\t\tstack.push({ x, y: y + 1 });\n\t\tstack.push({ x, y: y - 1 });\n\t}\n}\n\nexport const processImage = (cv: any, imageElement: HTMLImageElement, options: ProcessingOptions): string => {"
}

  "new_string": "export interface ProcessingOptions {\n\tremoveCheckered: boolean;\n\tremoveSolid: boolean;\n\tremoveShadow: boolean;\n\ttolerance: number;\n}\n\nexport const generatePreviewMask = (cv: any, imageElement: HTMLImageElement, options: ProcessingOptions): string => {\n\tif (!cv) {\n\t\tthrow new Error('OpenCV is not loaded yet. Please wait a moment and try again.');\n\t}\n\n\tconst src = cv.imread(imageElement);\n\ttry {\n\t\t// Convert to RGBA if not already\n\t\tif (src.channels() === 3) {\n\t\t\tcv.cvtColor(src, src, cv.COLOR_RGB2RGBA);\n\t\t}\n\n\t\t// Create mask to track what will be removed\n\t\tconst mask = new cv.Mat(src.rows, src.cols, cv.CV_8UC1, new cv.Scalar(0));\n\n\t\t// Apply same logic as processing but just create mask\n\t\tif (options.removeCheckered) {\n\t\t\tconst colors = sampleCheckerColors(src);\n\t\t\tif (colors.length > 0) {\n\t\t\t\tconst visited = new Array(src.rows).fill(0).map(() => new Array(src.cols).fill(false));\n\t\t\t\tconst seedPoints = [\n\t\t\t\t\t{ x: 0, y: 0 },\n\t\t\t\t\t{ x: src.cols - 1, y: 0 },\n\t\t\t\t\t{ x: 0, y: src.rows - 1 },\n\t\t\t\t\t{ x: src.cols - 1, y: src.rows - 1 },\n\t\t\t\t\t{ x: Math.floor(src.cols / 2), y: 0 },\n\t\t\t\t\t{ x: Math.floor(src.cols / 2), y: src.rows - 1 },\n\t\t\t\t\t{ x: 0, y: Math.floor(src.rows / 2) },\n\t\t\t\t\t{ x: src.cols - 1, y: Math.floor(src.rows / 2) },\n\t\t\t\t];\n\n\t\t\t\tfor (const seedPoint of seedPoints) {\n\t\t\t\t\tif (seedPoint.x < 0 || seedPoint.x >= src.cols || seedPoint.y < 0 || seedPoint.y >= src.rows) continue;\n\t\t\t\t\tif (visited[seedPoint.y][seedPoint.x]) continue;\n\n\t\t\t\t\tconst pixel = src.ucharPtr(seedPoint.y, seedPoint.x);\n\t\t\t\t\tconst seedR = pixel[0];\n\t\t\t\t\tconst seedG = pixel[1];\n\t\t\t\t\tconst seedB = pixel[2];\n\n\t\t\t\t\tlet matchesChecker = false;\n\t\t\t\t\tfor (const color of colors) {\n\t\t\t\t\t\tconst diff = Math.abs(seedR - color.r) + Math.abs(seedG - color.g) + Math.abs(seedB - color.b);\n\t\t\t\t\t\tif (diff < options.tolerance * 3) {\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\tmatchesChecker = true;\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\tbreak;\n\t\t\t\t\t\t}\n\t\t\t\t\t}\n\n\t\t\t\t\tif (matchesChecker) {\n\t\t\t\t\t\tmagicWandFillMask(src, mask, visited, seedPoint.x, seedPoint.y, seedR, seedG, seedB, options.tolerance);\n\t\t\t\t\t}\n\t\t\t\t}\n\t\t\t}\n\t\t}\n\n\t\tif (options.removeSolid) {\n\t\t\tconst visited = new Array(src.rows).fill(0).map(() => new Array(src.cols).fill(false));\n\t\t\tconst seedPoints = [\n\t\t\t\t{ x: 0, y: 0 },\n\t\t\t\t{ x: src.cols - 1, y: 0 },\n\t\t\t\t{ x: 0, y: src.rows - 1 },\n\t\t\t\t{ x: src.cols - 1, y: src.rows - 1 },\n\t\t\t\t{ x: Math.floor(src.cols / 2), y: 0 },\n\t\t\t\t{ x: Math.floor(src.cols / 2), y: src.rows - 1 },\n\t\t\t\t{ x: 0, y: Math.floor(src.rows / 2) },\n\t\t\t\t{ x: src.cols - 1, y: Math.floor(src.rows / 2) },\n\t\t\t];\n\n\t\t\tfor (const seedPoint of seedPoints) {\n\t\t\t\tif (seedPoint.x < 0 || seedPoint.x >= src.cols || seedPoint.y < 0 || seedPoint.y >= src.rows) continue;\n\t\t\t\tif (visited[seedPoint.y][seedPoint.x]) continue;\n\n\t\t\t\tconst pixel = src.ucharPtr(seedPoint.y, seedPoint.x);\n\t\t\t\tconst r = pixel[0];\n\t\t\t\tconst g = pixel[1];\n\t\t\t\tconst b = pixel[2];\n\n\t\t\t\tmagicWandFillMask(src, mask, visited, seedPoint.x, seedPoint.y, r, g, b, options.tolerance);\n\t\t\t}\n\t\t}\n\n\t\t// Create red overlay for masked areas\n\t\tconst overlay = new cv.Mat(src.rows, src.cols, cv.CV_8UC4);\n\t\tfor (let y = 0; y < src.rows; y++) {\n\t\t\tfor (let x = 0; x < src.cols; x++) {\n\t\t\t\tconst srcPixel = src.ucharPtr(y, x);\n\t\t\t\tconst overlayPixel = overlay.ucharPtr(y, x);\n\t\t\t\tconst maskValue = mask.ucharPtr(y, x)[0];\n\n\t\t\t\tif (maskValue === 255) {\n\t\t\t\t\t// Red overlay with 50% opacity\n\t\t\t\t\toverlayPixel[0] = Math.floor(srcPixel[0] * 0.5 + 255 * 0.5);\n\t\t\t\t\toverlayPixel[1] = Math.floor(srcPixel[1] * 0.5);\n\t\t\t\t\toverlayPixel[2] = Math.floor(srcPixel[2] * 0.5);\n\t\t\t\t\toverlayPixel[3] = 255;\n\t\t\t\t} else {\n\t\t\t\t\toverlayPixel[0] = srcPixel[0];\n\t\t\t\t\toverlayPixel[1] = srcPixel[1];\n\t\t\t\t\toverlayPixel[2] = srcPixel[2];\n\t\t\t\t\toverlayPixel[3] = srcPixel[3] || 255;\n\t\t\t\t}\n\t\t\t}\n\t\t}\n\n\t\tconst canvas = document.createElement('canvas');\n\t\tcanvas.width = imageElement.naturalWidth || src.cols;\n\t\tcanvas.height = imageElement.naturalHeight || src.rows;\n\t\tcv.imshow(canvas, overlay);\n\t\tconst dataUrl = canvas.toDataURL('image/png');\n\n\t\tmask.delete();\n\t\toverlay.delete();\n\t\treturn dataUrl;\n\t} finally {\n\t\tsrc.delete();\n\t}\n};\n\nfunction magicWandFillMask(\n\tsrc: any,\n\tmask: any,\n\tvisited: boolean[][],\n\tstartX: number,\n\tstartY: number,\n\ttargetR: number,\n\ttargetG: number,\n\ttargetB: number,\n\ttolerance: number\n): void {\n\tconst stack = [{ x: startX, y: startY }];\n\tconst rows = src.rows;\n\tconst cols = src.cols;\n\n\twhile (stack.length > 0) {\n\t\tconst { x, y } = stack.pop()!;\n\n\t\tif (x < 0 || x >= cols || y < 0 || y >= rows) continue;\n\t\tif (visited[y][x]) continue;\n\n\t\tconst pixel = src.ucharPtr(y, x);\n\t\tconst r = pixel[0];\n\t\tconst g = pixel[1];\n\t\tconst b = pixel[2];\n\n\t\tconst diff = Math.abs(r - targetR) + Math.abs(g - targetG) + Math.abs(b - targetB);\n\t\tif (diff > tolerance * 3) continue;\n\n\t\tvisited[y][x] = true;\n\t\tmask.ucharPtr(y, x)[0] = 255;\n\n\t\tstack.push({ x: x + 1, y });\n\t\tstack.push({ x: x - 1, y });\n\t\tstack.push({ x, y: y + 1 });\n\t\tstack.push({ x, y: y - 1 });\n\t}\n}\n\nexport const processImage = (cv: any, imageElement: HTMLImageElement, options: ProcessingOptions): string => {"
}

            üß∞ Tool Result: Toolu_01Vrsvyiqyv3D4Uo852Svtps
            

                2025-10-07 13:20:18
                
            

        

        

    

        
            
The file /Users/jagzviruz/projects/personal/remove-bg/src/utils/imageProcessor.ts has been updated. Here's the result of running `cat -n` on a snippet of the edited file:
     1‚Üíexport interface ...

        
        

            
The file /Users/jagzviruz/projects/personal/remove-bg/src/utils/imageProcessor.ts has been updated. Here's the result of running `cat -n` on a snippet of the edited file:
     1‚Üíexport interface ProcessingOptions {
     2‚Üí	removeCheckered: boolean;
     3‚Üí	removeSolid: boolean;
     4‚Üí	removeShadow: boolean;
     5‚Üí	tolerance: number;
     6‚Üí}
     7‚Üí
     8‚Üíexport const generatePreviewMask = (cv: any, imageElement: HTMLImageElement, options: ProcessingOptions): string => {
     9‚Üí	if (!cv) {
    10‚Üí		throw new Error('OpenCV is not loaded yet. Please wait a moment and try again.');
    11‚Üí	}
    12‚Üí
    13‚Üí	const src = cv.imread(imageElement);
    14‚Üí	try {
    15‚Üí		// Convert to RGBA if not already
    16‚Üí		if (src.channels() === 3) {
    17‚Üí			cv.cvtColor(src, src, cv.COLOR_RGB2RGBA);
    18‚Üí		}
    19‚Üí
    20‚Üí		// Create mask to track what will be removed
    21‚Üí		const mask = new cv.Mat(src.rows, src.cols, cv.CV_8UC1, new cv.Scalar(0));
    22‚Üí
    23‚Üí		// Apply same logic as processing but just create mask
    24‚Üí		if (options.removeCheckered) {
    25‚Üí			const colors = sampleCheckerColors(src);
    26‚Üí			if (colors.length > 0) {
    27‚Üí				const visited = new Array(src.rows).fill(0).map(() => new Array(src.cols).fill(false));
    28‚Üí				const seedPoints = [
    29‚Üí					{ x: 0, y: 0 },
    30‚Üí					{ x: src.cols - 1, y: 0 },
    31‚Üí					{ x: 0, y: src.rows - 1 },
    32‚Üí					{ x: src.cols - 1, y: src.rows - 1 },
    33‚Üí					{ x: Math.floor(src.cols / 2), y: 0 },
    34‚Üí					{ x: Math.floor(src.cols / 2), y: src.rows - 1 },
    35‚Üí					{ x: 0, y: Math.floor(src.rows / 2) },
    36‚Üí					{ x: src.cols - 1, y: Math.floor(src.rows / 2) },
    37‚Üí				];
    38‚Üí
    39‚Üí				for (const seedPoint of seedPoints) {
    40‚Üí					if (seedPoint.x < 0 || seedPoint.x >= src.cols || seedPoint.y < 0 || seedPoint.y >= src.rows) continue;
    41‚Üí					if (visited[seedPoint.y][seedPoint.x]) continue;
    42‚Üí
    43‚Üí					const pixel = src.ucharPtr(seedPoint.y, seedPoint.x);
    44‚Üí					const seedR = pixel[0];
    45‚Üí					const seedG = pixel[1];
    46‚Üí					const seedB = pixel[2];
    47‚Üí
    48‚Üí					let matchesChecker = false;
    49‚Üí					for (const color of colors) {
    50‚Üí						const diff = Math.abs(seedR - color.r) + Math.abs(seedG - color.g) + Math.abs(seedB - color.b);
    51‚Üí						if (diff < options.tolerance * 3) {
    52‚Üí							matchesChecker = true;
    53‚Üí							break;
    54‚Üí						}
    55‚Üí					}
    56‚Üí
    57‚Üí					if (matchesChecker) {
    58‚Üí						magicWandFillMask(src, mask, visited, seedPoint.x, seedPoint.y, seedR, seedG, seedB, options.tolerance);
    59‚Üí					}
    60‚Üí				}
    61‚Üí			}
    62‚Üí		}
    63‚Üí
    64‚Üí		if (options.removeSolid) {
    65‚Üí			const visited = new Array(src.rows).fill(0).map(() => new Array(src.cols).fill(false));
    66‚Üí			const seedPoints = [
    67‚Üí				{ x: 0, y: 0 },
    68‚Üí				{ x: src.cols - 1, y: 0 },
    69‚Üí				{ x: 0, y: src.rows - 1 },
    70‚Üí				{ x: src.cols - 1, y: src.rows - 1 },
    71‚Üí				{ x: Math.floor(src.cols / 2), y: 0 },
    72‚Üí				{ x: Math.floor(src.cols / 2), y: src.rows - 1 },
    73‚Üí				{ x: 0, y: Math.floor(src.rows / 2) },
    74‚Üí				{ x: src.cols - 1, y: Math.floor(src.rows / 2) },
    75‚Üí			];
    76‚Üí
    77‚Üí			for (const seedPoint of seedPoints) {
    78‚Üí				if (seedPoint.x < 0 || seedPoint.x >= src.cols || seedPoint.y < 0 || seedPoint.y >= src.rows) continue;
    79‚Üí				if (visited[seedPoint.y][seedPoint.x]) continue;
    80‚Üí
    81‚Üí				const pixel = src.ucharPtr(seedPoint.y, seedPoint.x);
    82‚Üí				const r = pixel[0];
    83‚Üí				const g = pixel[1];
    84‚Üí				const b = pixel[2];
    85‚Üí
    86‚Üí				magicWandFillMask(src, mask, visited, seedPoint.x, seedPoint.y, r, g, b, options.tolerance);
    87‚Üí			}
    88‚Üí		}
    89‚Üí
    90‚Üí		// Create red overlay for masked areas
    91‚Üí		const overlay = new cv.Mat(src.rows, src.cols, cv.CV_8UC4);
    92‚Üí		for (let y = 0; y < src.rows; y++) {
    93‚Üí			for (let x = 0; x < src.cols; x++) {
    94‚Üí				const srcPixel = src.ucharPtr(y, x);
    95‚Üí				const overlayPixel = overlay.ucharPtr(y, x);
    96‚Üí				const maskValue = mask.ucharPtr(y, x)[0];
    97‚Üí
    98‚Üí				if (maskValue === 255) {
    99‚Üí					// Red overlay with 50% opacity
   100‚Üí					overlayPixel[0] = Math.floor(srcPixel[0] * 0.5 + 255 * 0.5);
   101‚Üí					overlayPixel[1] = Math.floor(srcPixel[1] * 0.5);
   102‚Üí					overlayPixel[2] = Math.floor(srcPixel[2] * 0.5);
   103‚Üí					overlayPixel[3] = 255;
   104‚Üí				} else {
   105‚Üí					overlayPixel[0] = srcPixel[0];
   106‚Üí					overlayPixel[1] = srcPixel[1];
   107‚Üí					overlayPixel[2] = srcPixel[2];
   108‚Üí					overlayPixel[3] = srcPixel[3] || 255;
   109‚Üí				}
   110‚Üí			}
   111‚Üí		}
   112‚Üí
   113‚Üí		const canvas = document.createElement('canvas');
   114‚Üí		canvas.width = imageElement.naturalWidth || src.cols;
   115‚Üí		canvas.height = imageElement.naturalHeight || src.rows;
   116‚Üí		cv.imshow(canvas, overlay);
   117‚Üí		const dataUrl = canvas.toDataURL('image/png');
   118‚Üí
   119‚Üí		mask.delete();
   120‚Üí		overlay.delete();
   121‚Üí		return dataUrl;
   122‚Üí	} finally {
   123‚Üí		src.delete();
   124‚Üí	}
   125‚Üí};
   126‚Üí
   127‚Üífunction magicWandFillMask(
   128‚Üí	src: any,
   129‚Üí	mask: any,
   130‚Üí	visited: boolean[][],
   131‚Üí	startX: number,
   132‚Üí	startY: number,
   133‚Üí	targetR: number,
   134‚Üí	targetG: number,
   135‚Üí	targetB: number,
   136‚Üí	tolerance: number
   137‚Üí): void {
   138‚Üí	const stack = [{ x: startX, y: startY }];
   139‚Üí	const rows = src.rows;
   140‚Üí	const cols = src.cols;
   141‚Üí
   142‚Üí	while (stack.length > 0) {
   143‚Üí		const { x, y } = stack.pop()!;
   144‚Üí
   145‚Üí		if (x < 0 || x >= cols || y < 0 || y >= rows) continue;
   146‚Üí		if (visited[y][x]) continue;
   147‚Üí
   148‚Üí		const pixel = src.ucharPtr(y, x);
   149‚Üí		const r = pixel[0];
   150‚Üí		const g = pixel[1];
   151‚Üí		const b = pixel[2];
   152‚Üí
   153‚Üí		const diff = Math.abs(r - targetR) + Math.abs(g - targetG) + Math.abs(b - targetB);
   154‚Üí		if (diff > tolerance * 3) continue;
   155‚Üí
   156‚Üí		visited[y][x] = true;
   157‚Üí		mask.ucharPtr(y, x)[0] = 255;
   158‚Üí
   159‚Üí		stack.push({ x: x + 1, y });
   160‚Üí		stack.push({ x: x - 1, y });
   161‚Üí		stack.push({ x, y: y + 1 });
   162‚Üí		stack.push({ x, y: y - 1 });
   163‚Üí	}
   164‚Üí}
   165‚Üí
   166‚Üíexport const processImage = (cv: any, imageElement: HTMLImageElement, options: ProcessingOptions): string => {
   167‚Üí	if (!cv) {
   168‚Üí		throw new Error('OpenCV is not loaded yet. Please wait a moment and try again.');
   169‚Üí	}
   170‚Üí	// Read image

                2025-10-07 13:20:18

     1‚Üíexport interface ...

        
        

            
The file /Users/jagzviruz/projects/personal/remove-bg/src/utils/imageProcessor.ts has been updated. Here's the result of running `cat -n` on a snippet of the edited file:
     1‚Üíexport interface ProcessingOptions {
     2‚Üí	removeCheckered: boolean;
     3‚Üí	removeSolid: boolean;
     4‚Üí	removeShadow: boolean;
     5‚Üí	tolerance: number;
     6‚Üí}
     7‚Üí
     8‚Üíexport const generatePreviewMask = (cv: any, imageElement: HTMLImageElement, options: ProcessingOptions): string => {
     9‚Üí	if (!cv) {
    10‚Üí		throw new Error('OpenCV is not loaded yet. Please wait a moment and try again.');
    11‚Üí	}
    12‚Üí
    13‚Üí	const src = cv.imread(imageElement);
    14‚Üí	try {
    15‚Üí		// Convert to RGBA if not already
    16‚Üí		if (src.channels() === 3) {
    17‚Üí			cv.cvtColor(src, src, cv.COLOR_RGB2RGBA);
    18‚Üí		}
    19‚Üí
    20‚Üí		// Create mask to track what will be removed
    21‚Üí		const mask = new cv.Mat(src.rows, src.cols, cv.CV_8UC1, new cv.Scalar(0));
    22‚Üí
    23‚Üí		// Apply same logic as processing but just create mask
    24‚Üí		if (options.removeCheckered) {
    25‚Üí			const colors = sampleCheckerColors(src);
    26‚Üí			if (colors.length > 0) {
    27‚Üí				const visited = new Array(src.rows).fill(0).map(() => new Array(src.cols).fill(false));
    28‚Üí				const seedPoints = [
    29‚Üí					{ x: 0, y: 0 },
    30‚Üí					{ x: src.cols - 1, y: 0 },
    31‚Üí					{ x: 0, y: src.rows - 1 },
    32‚Üí					{ x: src.cols - 1, y: src.rows - 1 },
    33‚Üí					{ x: Math.floor(src.cols / 2), y: 0 },
    34‚Üí					{ x: Math.floor(src.cols / 2), y: src.rows - 1 },
    35‚Üí					{ x: 0, y: Math.floor(src.rows / 2) },
    36‚Üí					{ x: src.cols - 1, y: Math.floor(src.rows / 2) },
    37‚Üí				];
    38‚Üí
    39‚Üí				for (const seedPoint of seedPoints) {
    40‚Üí					if (seedPoint.x < 0 || seedPoint.x >= src.cols || seedPoint.y < 0 || seedPoint.y >= src.rows) continue;
    41‚Üí					if (visited[seedPoint.y][seedPoint.x]) continue;
    42‚Üí
    43‚Üí					const pixel = src.ucharPtr(seedPoint.y, seedPoint.x);
    44‚Üí					const seedR = pixel[0];
    45‚Üí					const seedG = pixel[1];
    46‚Üí					const seedB = pixel[2];
    47‚Üí
    48‚Üí					let matchesChecker = false;
    49‚Üí					for (const color of colors) {
    50‚Üí						const diff = Math.abs(seedR - color.r) + Math.abs(seedG - color.g) + Math.abs(seedB - color.b);
    51‚Üí						if (diff < options.tolerance * 3) {
    52‚Üí							matchesChecker = true;
    53‚Üí							break;
    54‚Üí						}
    55‚Üí					}
    56‚Üí
    57‚Üí					if (matchesChecker) {
    58‚Üí						magicWandFillMask(src, mask, visited, seedPoint.x, seedPoint.y, seedR, seedG, seedB, options.tolerance);
    59‚Üí					}
    60‚Üí				}
    61‚Üí			}
    62‚Üí		}
    63‚Üí
    64‚Üí		if (options.removeSolid) {
    65‚Üí			const visited = new Array(src.rows).fill(0).map(() => new Array(src.cols).fill(false));
    66‚Üí			const seedPoints = [
    67‚Üí				{ x: 0, y: 0 },
    68‚Üí				{ x: src.cols - 1, y: 0 },
    69‚Üí				{ x: 0, y: src.rows - 1 },
    70‚Üí				{ x: src.cols - 1, y: src.rows - 1 },
    71‚Üí				{ x: Math.floor(src.cols / 2), y: 0 },
    72‚Üí				{ x: Math.floor(src.cols / 2), y: src.rows - 1 },
    73‚Üí				{ x: 0, y: Math.floor(src.rows / 2) },
    74‚Üí				{ x: src.cols - 1, y: Math.floor(src.rows / 2) },
    75‚Üí			];
    76‚Üí
    77‚Üí			for (const seedPoint of seedPoints) {
    78‚Üí				if (seedPoint.x < 0 || seedPoint.x >= src.cols || seedPoint.y < 0 || seedPoint.y >= src.rows) continue;
    79‚Üí				if (visited[seedPoint.y][seedPoint.x]) continue;
    80‚Üí
    81‚Üí				const pixel = src.ucharPtr(seedPoint.y, seedPoint.x);
    82‚Üí				const r = pixel[0];
    83‚Üí				const g = pixel[1];
    84‚Üí				const b = pixel[2];
    85‚Üí
    86‚Üí				magicWandFillMask(src, mask, visited, seedPoint.x, seedPoint.y, r, g, b, options.tolerance);
    87‚Üí			}
    88‚Üí		}
    89‚Üí
    90‚Üí		// Create red overlay for masked areas
    91‚Üí		const overlay = new cv.Mat(src.rows, src.cols, cv.CV_8UC4);
    92‚Üí		for (let y = 0; y < src.rows; y++) {
    93‚Üí			for (let x = 0; x < src.cols; x++) {
    94‚Üí				const srcPixel = src.ucharPtr(y, x);
    95‚Üí				const overlayPixel = overlay.ucharPtr(y, x);
    96‚Üí				const maskValue = mask.ucharPtr(y, x)[0];
    97‚Üí
    98‚Üí				if (maskValue === 255) {
    99‚Üí					// Red overlay with 50% opacity
   100‚Üí					overlayPixel[0] = Math.floor(srcPixel[0] * 0.5 + 255 * 0.5);
   101‚Üí					overlayPixel[1] = Math.floor(srcPixel[1] * 0.5);
   102‚Üí					overlayPixel[2] = Math.floor(srcPixel[2] * 0.5);
   103‚Üí					overlayPixel[3] = 255;
   104‚Üí				} else {
   105‚Üí					overlayPixel[0] = srcPixel[0];
   106‚Üí					overlayPixel[1] = srcPixel[1];
   107‚Üí					overlayPixel[2] = srcPixel[2];
   108‚Üí					overlayPixel[3] = srcPixel[3] || 255;
   109‚Üí				}
   110‚Üí			}
   111‚Üí		}
   112‚Üí
   113‚Üí		const canvas = document.createElement('canvas');
   114‚Üí		canvas.width = imageElement.naturalWidth || src.cols;
   115‚Üí		canvas.height = imageElement.naturalHeight || src.rows;
   116‚Üí		cv.imshow(canvas, overlay);
   117‚Üí		const dataUrl = canvas.toDataURL('image/png');
   118‚Üí
   119‚Üí		mask.delete();
   120‚Üí		overlay.delete();
   121‚Üí		return dataUrl;
   122‚Üí	} finally {
   123‚Üí		src.delete();
   124‚Üí	}
   125‚Üí};
   126‚Üí
   127‚Üífunction magicWandFillMask(
   128‚Üí	src: any,
   129‚Üí	mask: any,
   130‚Üí	visited: boolean[][],
   131‚Üí	startX: number,
   132‚Üí	startY: number,
   133‚Üí	targetR: number,
   134‚Üí	targetG: number,
   135‚Üí	targetB: number,
   136‚Üí	tolerance: number
   137‚Üí): void {
   138‚Üí	const stack = [{ x: startX, y: startY }];
   139‚Üí	const rows = src.rows;
   140‚Üí	const cols = src.cols;
   141‚Üí
   142‚Üí	while (stack.length > 0) {
   143‚Üí		const { x, y } = stack.pop()!;
   144‚Üí
   145‚Üí		if (x < 0 || x >= cols || y < 0 || y >= rows) continue;
   146‚Üí		if (visited[y][x]) continue;
   147‚Üí
   148‚Üí		const pixel = src.ucharPtr(y, x);
   149‚Üí		const r = pixel[0];
   150‚Üí		const g = pixel[1];
   151‚Üí		const b = pixel[2];
   152‚Üí
   153‚Üí		const diff = Math.abs(r - targetR) + Math.abs(g - targetG) + Math.abs(b - targetB);
   154‚Üí		if (diff > tolerance * 3) continue;
   155‚Üí
   156‚Üí		visited[y][x] = true;
   157‚Üí		mask.ucharPtr(y, x)[0] = 255;
   158‚Üí
   159‚Üí		stack.push({ x: x + 1, y });
   160‚Üí		stack.push({ x: x - 1, y });
   161‚Üí		stack.push({ x, y: y + 1 });
   162‚Üí		stack.push({ x, y: y - 1 });
   163‚Üí	}
   164‚Üí}
   165‚Üí
   166‚Üíexport const processImage = (cv: any, imageElement: HTMLImageElement, options: ProcessingOptions): string => {
   167‚Üí	if (!cv) {
   168‚Üí		throw new Error('OpenCV is not loaded yet. Please wait a moment and try again.');
   169‚Üí	}
   170‚Üí	// Read image

The file /Users/jagzviruz/projects/personal/remove-bg/src/App.tsx has been updated. Here's the result of running `cat -n` on a snippet of the edited file:

    98‚Üí							) : (
    99‚Üí								<svg className="w-5 h-5" fill="none" viewBox="0 0 24 24" stroke="currentColor">
   100‚Üí									<path strokeLinecap="round" strokeLinejoin="round" strokeWidth={2} d="M15 12a3 3 0 11-6 0 3 3 0 016 0z" />
   101‚Üí									<path strokeLinecap="round" strokeLinejoin="round" strokeWidth={2} d="M2.458 12C3.732 7.943 7.523 5 12 5c4.478 0 8.268 2.943 9.542 7-1.274 4.057-5.064 7-9.542 7-4.477 0-8.268-2.943-9.542-7z" />
   102‚Üí								</svg>
   103‚Üí							)}
   104‚Üí							<span>{showingPreview ? 'Hide Preview' : 'Preview Removal'}</span>
   105‚Üí						</div>
   106‚Üí					</button>
   107‚Üí
   108‚Üí					<button
   109‚Üí						onClick={onProcess}
   110‚Üí						disabled={disabled}
   111‚Üí						aria-busy={disabled}
   112‚Üí						className="relative w-full group overflow-hidden">
   113‚Üí						{/* Animated glow background */}
   114‚Üí						<div className="absolute inset-0 bg-gradient-to-r from-blue-600 via-blue-500 to-purple-600 rounded-xl opacity-100 group-hover:opacity-0 transition-opacity duration-300"></div>
   115‚Üí						<div className="absolute inset-0 bg-gradient-to-r from-purple-600 via-pink-500 to-blue-600 rounded-xl opacity-0 group-hover:opacity-100 transition-opacity duration-300"></div>
   116‚Üí						<div className="absolute -inset-1 bg-gradient-to-r from-blue-600 via-purple-600 to-pink-600 rounded-xl blur-lg opacity-0 group-hover:opacity-75 transition-opacity duration-300 group-disabled:opacity-0"></div>
   117‚Üí
   118‚Üí						{/* Button content */}
   119‚Üí						<div className="relative flex items-center justify-center gap-3 py-4 px-6 text-white font-bold text-lg rounded-xl disabled:opacity-50 disabled:cursor-not-allowed transition-all duration-300 group-hover:scale-[1.02] group-active:scale-[0.98]">
   120‚Üí							{disabled && (
   121‚Üí								<span className="inline-block animate-spin rounded-full h-5 w-5 border-3 border-white border-t-transparent"></span>
   122‚Üí							)}
   123‚Üí							<span>{disabled ? 'Processing‚Ä¶' : 'Process Image'}</span>
   124‚Üí							{!disabled && (
   125‚Üí								<svg className="w-5 h-5 group-hover:translate-x-1 transition-transform" fill="none" viewBox="0 0 24 24" stroke="currentColor">
   126‚Üí									<path strokeLinecap="round" strokeLinejoin="round" strokeWidth={2} d="M13 7l5 5m0 0l-5 5m5-5H6" />
   127‚Üí								</svg>
   128‚Üí							)}
   129‚Üí						</div>
   130‚Üí					</button>
   131‚Üí				</div>
   132‚Üí			</div>
   133‚Üí		</div>
   134‚Üí	);
   135‚Üí};

            üõ†Ô∏è Tool Use: Edit (Id: Toolu_01Lfmsxcrvnkyrsjrnbhtfkm)
            

                2025-10-07 13:20:42
                
            

        

        

    

        
            
{
  "file_path": "/Users/jagzviruz/projects/personal/remove-bg/CLAUDE.md",
  "old_string": "**Background removal algorithms** (use continuous region detection, not g...

        
        

            
{
  "file_path": "/Users/jagzviruz/projects/personal/remove-bg/CLAUDE.md",
  "old_string": "**Background removal algorithms** (use continuous region detection, not global color matching):\n- **Solid background**: Uses `floodFill` with `FLOODFILL_MASK_ONLY` flag from 8 seed points (4 corners + 4 edge midpoints). Only removes pixels that are part of continuous regions connected to edges. This prevents removing foreground objects that happen to match the background color.\n- **Checkered pattern**: First samples corner/edge pixels to detect checker colors, then uses `floodFill` from edge points that match those colors. Only removes continuous checkered regions connected to edges.\n- Both algorithms use a mask (rows+2, cols+2) for flood fill operations and only mark pixels as transparent if they were reached by the flood fill from edge seed points",
  "new_string": "**Background removal algorithms** (use continuous region detection, not global color matching):\n- **Solid background**: Uses magic wand style flood fill from 8 seed points (4 corners + 4 edge midpoints). Only removes pixels that are part of continuous regions connected to edges. This prevents removing foreground objects that happen to match the background color.\n- **Checkered pattern**: First samples corner/edge pixels to detect checker colors, then uses magic wand flood fill from edge points that match those colors. Only removes continuous checkered regions connected to edges.\n- Both algorithms use iterative stack-based flood fill with a visited array to track processed pixels\n- **Preview mode**: `generatePreviewMask()` runs the same algorithms but creates a red overlay (50% opacity) instead of transparency, allowing users to see what will be removed before processing"
}

        

    

    

    

    
    
    
    

        

            üõ†Ô∏è Tool Use: Edit (Id: Toolu_01Lfmsxcrvnkyrsjrnbhtfkm)
            

                2025-10-07 13:20:42
                
            

        

        

    

        
            
{
  "file_path": "/Users/jagzviruz/projects/personal/remove-bg/CLAUDE.md",
  "old_string": "**Background removal algorithms** (use continuous region detection, not g...

        
        

            
{
  "file_path": "/Users/jagzviruz/projects/personal/remove-bg/CLAUDE.md",
  "old_string": "**Background removal algorithms** (use continuous region detection, not global color matching):\n- **Solid background**: Uses `floodFill` with `FLOODFILL_MASK_ONLY` flag from 8 seed points (4 corners + 4 edge midpoints). Only removes pixels that are part of continuous regions connected to edges. This prevents removing foreground objects that happen to match the background color.\n- **Checkered pattern**: First samples corner/edge pixels to detect checker colors, then uses `floodFill` from edge points that match those colors. Only removes continuous checkered regions connected to edges.\n- Both algorithms use a mask (rows+2, cols+2) for flood fill operations and only mark pixels as transparent if they were reached by the flood fill from edge seed points",
  "new_string": "**Background removal algorithms** (use continuous region detection, not global color matching):\n- **Solid background**: Uses magic wand style flood fill from 8 seed points (4 corners + 4 edge midpoints). Only removes pixels that are part of continuous regions connected to edges. This prevents removing foreground objects that happen to match the background color.\n- **Checkered pattern**: First samples corner/edge pixels to detect checker colors, then uses magic wand flood fill from edge points that match those colors. Only removes continuous checkered regions connected to edges.\n- Both algorithms use iterative stack-based flood fill with a visited array to track processed pixels\n- **Preview mode**: `generatePreviewMask()` runs the same algorithms but creates a red overlay (50% opacity) instead of transparency, allowing users to see what will be removed before processing"
}

        

    

    

    

    
    
    
    

        

            üß∞ Tool Result: Toolu_01Lfmsxcrvnkyrsjrnbhtfkm

The file /Users/jagzviruz/projects/personal/remove-bg/CLAUDE.md has been updated. Here's the result of running `cat -n` on a snippet of the edited file:
    78‚Üí- Apply processing functions that m...

        
        

            
The file /Users/jagzviruz/projects/personal/remove-bg/CLAUDE.md has been updated. Here's the result of running `cat -n` on a snippet of the edited file:
    78‚Üí- Apply processing functions that modify alpha
    79‚Üí- Merge channels and export via canvas.toDataURL()
    80‚Üí- CRITICAL: Delete all Mat objects to avoid memory leaks
    81‚Üí
    82‚Üí**Background removal algorithms** (use continuous region detection, not global color matching):
    83‚Üí- **Solid background**: Uses magic wand style flood fill from 8 seed points (4 corners + 4 edge midpoints). Only removes pixels that are part of continuous regions connected to edges. This prevents removing foreground objects that happen to match the background color.
    84‚Üí- **Checkered pattern**: First samples corner/edge pixels to detect checker colors, then uses magic wand flood fill from edge points that match those colors. Only removes continuous checkered regions connected to edges.
    85‚Üí- Both algorithms use iterative stack-based flood fill with a visited array to track processed pixels
    86‚Üí- **Preview mode**: `generatePreviewMask()` runs the same algorithms but creates a red overlay (50% opacity) instead of transparency, allowing users to see what will be removed before processing
    87‚Üí
    88‚Üí## Deployment
    89‚Üí
    90‚ÜíGitHub Actions workflow deploys to GitHub Pages on push to main:

    78‚Üí- Apply processing functions that m...

        
        

            
The file /Users/jagzviruz/projects/personal/remove-bg/CLAUDE.md has been updated. Here's the result of running `cat -n` on a snippet of the edited file:
    78‚Üí- Apply processing functions that modify alpha
    79‚Üí- Merge channels and export via canvas.toDataURL()
    80‚Üí- CRITICAL: Delete all Mat objects to avoid memory leaks
    81‚Üí
    82‚Üí**Background removal algorithms** (use continuous region detection, not global color matching):
    83‚Üí- **Solid background**: Uses magic wand style flood fill from 8 seed points (4 corners + 4 edge midpoints). Only removes pixels that are part of continuous regions connected to edges. This prevents removing foreground objects that happen to match the background color.
    84‚Üí- **Checkered pattern**: First samples corner/edge pixels to detect checker colors, then uses magic wand flood fill from edge points that match those colors. Only removes continuous checkered regions connected to edges.
    85‚Üí- Both algorithms use iterative stack-based flood fill with a visited array to track processed pixels
    86‚Üí- **Preview mode**: `generatePreviewMask()` runs the same algorithms but creates a red overlay (50% opacity) instead of transparency, allowing users to see what will be removed before processing
    87‚Üí
    88‚Üí## Deployment
    89‚Üí
    90‚ÜíGitHub Actions workflow deploys to GitHub Pages on push to main:

            ü§ñ Assistant
            

                2025-10-07 13:20:57
                
            

        

        
Perfect! I've implemented a preview feature with red overlay mask that shows which areas will be removed. Here's what I added:


Preview Feature Implementation:


New Functionality:


    

  1. "Preview Removal" Button - Added above the "Process Image" button
    

      

    • Click to generate and display preview
      • 

    • Shows as "Hide Preview" when active
      • 

    • Eye icon for visual clarity
      • 

    

    2. 

  2. Red Overlay Mask - Shows removal areas at 50% opacity
    

      

    • Red tint indicates what will be removed
      • 

    • Original image visible underneath
      • 

    • "Preview Mode" badge in top-right corner
      • 

    

    3. 

  3. Performance Optimized:
    

      

    • Preview only generates when button is clicked (not on every settings change)
      • 

    • Uses same magic wand algorithm as processing
      • 

    • Runs in separate function generatePreviewMask()
      • 

    • Properly cleans up OpenCV Mat objects
      • 

    

    4. 



How It Works:


    

  1. User uploads image and adjusts settings
    2. 

  2. Click "Preview Removal" to see red overlay on areas that will be removed
    3. 

  3. Adjust tolerance/options and click preview again to update
    4. 

  4. Click "Hide Preview" to see original image
    5. 

  5. Click "Process Image" to actually remove background
    6. 



Technical Details:


    

  • Separate magicWandFillMask() function creates mask without modifying alpha
    • 

  • Red overlay: R = original * 0.5 + 255 * 0.5, G/B = original * 0.5
    • 

  • No shadow preview (shadow removal uses different algorithm)
    • 

  • State management: previewMask stores overlay, showPreview toggles display
    • 



The feature is now live at http://localhost:5173/ - test it by uploading an image and clicking "Preview Removal"!

    2.
